original: rlung gis bskyod par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod par gyur pa yi //
translated: The heavy does not have the nature of supporting.

original: sgra de de yis 'dzin 'dod de //
analyzed: sgra de de yis 'dzin 'dod de //
translated: If sound is held to be grasped by that,

original: gal te nam mkha' 'dzi min na //üîΩde ni 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' 'dzi min na // de ni 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: If space is not grasped,üîΩIt would be subject to destruction.

original: ltos nas 'jig 'gyur de lta bu //
analyzed: ltos nas 'jig 'gyur de lta bu //
translated: In dependence, it would be subject to destruction.

original: de ni de yi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: de ni de yi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: That is its very nature.

original: 'jig rgyu med kyi bar du de //
analyzed: 'jig rgyu med kyi bar du de //
translated: Until there is a cause for destruction,

original: gnas pa'i phyir na rten gzhan med //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir na rten gzhan med //
translated: It would remain, so there would be no other basis.

original: de ltar de ni med par //
analyzed: de ltar de ni med par //
translated: In that way, it would remain

original: gnas 'gyur 'di ni nges pa nyid //üîΩgal te skad cig gnas pa dang // dus gzhan gnas la yod min la //
analyzed: gnas 'gyur 'di ni nges pa nyid // gal te skad cig gnas pa dang // dus gzhan gnas la yod min la //
translated: Without ceasing‚Äîthis is certain.üîΩIf it abides for an instant,üîΩIt would not abide at another time.

original: rtag rnams la yod yod min na //
analyzed: rtag rnams la yod yod min na //
translated: If it abides, it would not abide.

original: rten nyid de ni don med yin //
analyzed: rten nyid de ni don med yin //
translated: That basis would be meaningless.

original: de bden de ltar na yang 'di //
analyzed: de bden de ltar na yang 'di //
translated: If that is true, then

original: rtag tu lhan cig skyes rang bzhin //
analyzed: rtag tu lhan cig skyes rang bzhin //
translated: It is always the nature of co-arising.

original: 'di yang dpyad par bya min zhes //
analyzed: 'di yang dpyad par bya min zhes //
translated: This also should not be analyzed,

original: bya bar yang ni rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: bya bar yang ni rtogs pa yin //
translated: So it is understood.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi don la brten gyis don ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par sgrub par byed pa de ni brten pa nyid kyis gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon dang dam bca' ba'i skyon yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid kyi don la brten gyis don ma yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par sgrub par byed pa de ni brten pa nyid kyis gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi skyon dang dam bca' ba'i skyon yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of impermanence is based on the meaning of non-enduring, the proof of impermanence is undermined by its very basis. Therefore, it is a fault of the reason and a fault of the thesis.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
translated: If, because of accepting the treatise,

original: thams cad gzung bas de gcig la //
analyzed: thams cad gzung bas de gcig la //
translated: all are grasped by that one,üîΩthen the reason and thesis

original: rab tu gnod gang gtan tshigs dang // dam bca' ba dag skyon 'gyur na //
analyzed: rab tu gnod gang gtan tshigs dang // dam bca' ba dag skyon 'gyur na //
translated: are faulty because of contradiction.

original: sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa na //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa na //
translated: When proving sound is impermanent,

original: dri za'i yon tan bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dri za'i yon tan bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: because of refuting the Gandharva‚Äôs qualities,

original: gtan tshigs 'gal 'gyur skabs min phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal 'gyur skabs min phyir //
translated: the reason is contradictory. If that is not so,

original: min na de yi gzhan la 'ang mtshungs //
analyzed: min na de yi gzhan la 'ang mtshungs //
translated: then it is the same for others.

original: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs pa tsam gyis bstan bcos la gnod na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs pa tsam gyis bstan bcos la gnod na gtan tshigs dang dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur na /
translated: If the treatise is undermined merely by accepting the treatise, then the reason and thesis are faulty.

original: de'i tshe sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa bkag pa bzhin du dri za'i yon tan las bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa bkag pa bzhin du dri za'i yon tan las bzlog pa bsgrub pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the quality of sound is refuted as being a quality of space, in the same way, the quality of smell would be established as being the opposite of a quality of gandharvas.

original: gang gi phyir ci ltar des brjod pa de'i chos nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang 'brel par gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de bsgrub bya yin pa de bzhin du @155a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci ltar des brjod pa de'i chos nam mkha'i yon tan nyid dang 'brel par gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid de bsgrub bya yin pa de bzhin du @155a * //
translated: Because just as impermanence is related to the quality of sound, which is expressed by the word ‚Äúsound,‚Äù and is established as a quality of space,

original: bstan bcos de byed pa'i 'dod pa dri'i chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yon tan dang 'brel pa nyid dang bstan bcos des bsgrub par yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan bcos de byed pa'i 'dod pa dri'i chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa'i yon tan dang 'brel pa nyid dang bstan bcos des bsgrub par yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: in the same way, the quality of smell would be related to another subject, smell, which is desired by the author of the treatise, and would be established by that treatise.

original: de bkag na yang bstan bcos de dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir na dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba nyid do //üîΩdri ni skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir na ci ltar zhes kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bkag na yang bstan bcos de dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir na dam bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba nyid do // dri ni skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir na ci ltar zhes kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If that is refuted, it would be untenable for it to be related to that treatise, and thus it would be a fault of the thesis.üîΩBecause smell is not included in the context, it cannot be said to be ‚Äújust like.‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i yon tan yang skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan yang skabs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the quality of space is also not included in the context, it cannot be said to be ‚Äújust like.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between the two.

original: ci ste chos can 'dir skabs yin //
analyzed: ci ste chos can 'dir skabs yin //
translated: But if the subject is the topic here,

original: de la bstan bcos don gnod nyid //
analyzed: de la bstan bcos don gnod nyid //
translated: then the treatise is useless.

original: bstan bcos don khas blangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bstan bcos don khas blangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the meaning of the treatise is accepted,

original: chos can gzhan du'ang skabs cis min //
analyzed: chos can gzhan du'ang skabs cis min //
translated: why is it not also the topic of another subject?

original: gal te 'dir chos can skabs yin yang /
analyzed: gal te 'dir chos can skabs yin yang /
translated: Even if the subject is the topic here,

original: de ni chos de'i gzhi yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ni chos de'i gzhi yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: it is the basis of that subject.

original: 'on te bstan bcos kyi sgo nas chos gzhan gyi rten yin pas kyang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bstan bcos kyi sgo nas chos gzhan gyi rten yin pas kyang ngo zhe na /
translated: But if it is the basis of another subject by way of the treatise,

original: de lta na ni 'o na de dang bstan bcos gcig gis brjod pa chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir skyon mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de dang bstan bcos gcig gis brjod pa chos can gzhan dang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir skyon mtshungs so //
translated: then in that case, because it is related to another subject expressed by the same treatise, the fault is the same.

original: 'on te yang chos de'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos can skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te yang chos de'i gzhir gyur pa'i chos can skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the subject that is the basis of that subject is the topic,

original: chos gzhan yang bsgrub bya'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin te rgol bas kyang de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan yang bsgrub bya'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin te rgol bas kyang de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then another subject also belongs to the class of the probandum, because the opponent also asserts it in that way.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: That is expressed:

original: chos can chos sogs sgrub byed kyi //
analyzed: chos can chos sogs sgrub byed kyi //
translated: The qualities of space are established as the subject, etc.

original: ci ste rgol 'dod yin brjod na //
analyzed: ci ste rgol 'dod yin brjod na //
translated: If you say that the proponent wishes to state that,

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang rgol bas 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang rgol bas 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: then the qualities of space are also what the proponent wishes to state,

original: bsgrub bya'i chos can du bzung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos can du bzung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are qualities that are taken as the subject of the probandum.

original: mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du bsgrub bya'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no // de bzhin du bsgrub bya'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is like impermanence.üîΩIn the same way, it is because they are a particular of one part of the generality of the probandum.

original: de la brjod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin pa tsam gyis ni /
analyzed: de la brjod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin pa tsam gyis ni /
translated: To that we say: By the mere fact of being a particular of one part of the generality of the probandum,

original: skabs ma yin pa la 'dod pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa la 'dod pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: a desire does not arise for what is not the context.üîΩIn this way,

original: 'di ltar / gnas skabs 'ga' yis 'dod 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gnas skabs 'ga' yis 'dod 'gyur zhing //
translated: a desire arises from some circumstance,

original: de rtogs pa yang de dag gis //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang de dag gis //
translated: and that is understood by them.

original: nan gyis khyod 'di 'dod ces pa //
analyzed: nan gyis khyod 'di 'dod ces pa //
translated: You insistently say, ‚ÄúYou desire this,‚Äù

original: gsal bar dbang phyug dpyod pa yin /
analyzed: gsal bar dbang phyug dpyod pa yin /
translated: but that is clearly an analysis of ƒ™≈õvara.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid tsam ni 'dod pa 'jug par byed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid tsam ni 'dod pa 'jug par byed ba ma yin no //
translated: The mere particular of one part of the universal of the probandum is not what is to be admitted.

original: 'jug par byed na yang 'dod pa dang sgrub par byed ba 'jug pa rtag tu mi 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed na yang 'dod pa dang sgrub par byed ba 'jug pa rtag tu mi 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then the admission and the proof would be constantly occurring without interruption.

original: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid du @155b 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te bsgrub par bya ba'i spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid du @155b 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that it is the particular of one part of the universal of the probandum that is to be admitted,

original: de ltar yin na 'dod pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'ang yin la sgrub par byed par byed pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don nyid sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na 'dod pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'ang yin la sgrub par byed par byed pa yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don nyid sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since that very admission would be the probandum and that very admission would be the proof, the meaning of the thesis would be the proof.

original: de'i phyir skabs gang yin pa de nyid la 'dod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skabs gang yin pa de nyid la 'dod pa 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the admission occurs only in the context of the dispute.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro//
translated: If it were otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: des na rtsod pa'i gnas nyid la 'dod pa 'jug gi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rtsod pa'i gnas nyid la 'dod pa 'jug gi nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the admission occurs in the context of the dispute, not in the context of the quality of space.

original: gal te skabs las 'dod pa 'byung bas skabs ni de'i rgyu yin pas na de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'grub /
analyzed: gal te skabs las 'dod pa 'byung bas skabs ni de'i rgyu yin pas na de ltar rgyu las 'bras bu 'grub /
translated: If you assert that the meaning of a word is obtained from the context, then the context is the cause of the meaning. Thus, the result is established from the cause.

original: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The unimpeded potency of the cause makes the result understood.

original: ji ltar na de ltar rtogs par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar na de ltar rtogs par bya /
translated: How is it understood in that way?

original: de'i 'bras bu tshig mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu tshig mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the result of the cause is seen in the words.

original: 'o na ni 'bras bu tshig nyid las rtogs kyis skabs las ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de nyid kyis rtogs par brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'bras bu tshig nyid las rtogs kyis skabs las ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de nyid kyis rtogs par brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then the result is understood from the words themselves, not from the context. Therefore, how can you say that the meaning is understood from the context?

original: 'dir brjod pa /üîΩde nyid nus pa tshig las ni //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa / de nyid nus pa tshig las ni //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe potency of the word

original: rtogs 'gyur de las 'dod pa ni //üîΩnges pa nyid rtogs de yi phyir //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur de las 'dod pa ni // nges pa nyid rtogs de yi phyir //
translated: is understood from the word itself.üîΩThe meaning is understood from that.

original: skabs las rtogs par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: skabs las rtogs par brjod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is understood from the context.

original: tshig las ni 'dod pa tsam rtogs so //
analyzed: tshig las ni 'dod pa tsam rtogs so //
translated: The mere meaning is understood from the words.

original: skabs ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skabs ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The context is not the cause of the meaning, because the meaning is understood from the words themselves.

original: des na tshig gis rtogs pa nus pa thogs pa med pa'i skabs nyid 'dod pa so sor nges pa go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir na de nyid kyis yin par brjod do //
analyzed: des na tshig gis rtogs pa nus pa thogs pa med pa'i skabs nyid 'dod pa so sor nges pa go bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir na de nyid kyis yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the context itself is the expression of the individual ascertainment of the power of understanding through words, it is said to be just that.

original: skabs med kyang khyod kyi 'dod pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni rigs pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: skabs med kyang khyod kyi 'dod pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di la ni rigs pa ci yang med do //
translated: But even if there is no context, there is no logic at all in saying that this is your assertion.üîΩTherefore,

original: des na / 'bras bu'i rtags can min brjod de //
analyzed: des na / 'bras bu'i rtags can min brjod de //
translated: It is said that the effect is not the reason,

original: 'khrul pa yis ni gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yis ni gnod par 'gyur //
translated: Because it is harmed by error.

original: med na mi 'gyur min 'dod la //
analyzed: med na mi 'gyur min 'dod la //
translated: It is asserted that it does not occur if the other does not exist,

original: gnod kyang gzhan la ci zhig gnod //
analyzed: gnod kyang gzhan la ci zhig gnod //
translated: But how is the other harmed even if it is harmed?

original: 'bras bu tshig gam rgyu go bar byed pa yin la rgyu yang skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshig gam rgyu go bar byed pa yin la rgyu yang skabs yin no //
translated: The effect is either the expression or the cause, and the cause is the context.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la ni go bar byed pa med de de la rgyu de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la ni go bar byed pa med de de la rgyu de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the case of the quality of space, there is no expression, because that cause does not exist.

original: 'bras bu tshig de yang nam mkha'i yon tan la med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshig de yang nam mkha'i yon tan la med do //
translated: And that effect, the expression, does not exist in the quality of space.

original: de lta na yang 'di ni khyod 'dod pa yin no zhes 'bras bu'i rtags med par 'dod par brjod pa ni 'khrul pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni khyod 'dod pa yin no zhes 'bras bu'i rtags med par 'dod par brjod pa ni 'khrul pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúThis is what you accept,‚Äù then your statement that the effect is not a reason is undermined by delusion.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid la sogs pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin la nus pa thogs pa med ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba spyi'i phyogs gcig gi khyad par nyid la sogs pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ma yin la nus pa thogs pa med ba'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: The specific part of the general thesis is not the effect that you accept, nor is it a cause that is an unobstructed potency.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i don la gnod na ni khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i don la gnod na ni khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: If you undermine the meaning of the absence of an effect, then the pervasion is absent, and the probandum does not occur.

original: sgrub byed dang bsgrub par bya ba dag gi skyon du 'gyur ba @156a * //
analyzed: sgrub byed dang bsgrub par bya ba dag gi skyon du 'gyur ba @156a * //
translated: Therefore, the proof and the probandum are flawed.

original: yin no ; / nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: yin no ; / nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba'i don ma yin no //
translated: The quality of space is not the meaning of the absence of an effect.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa la gnod pa na de las gzhan pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod pa ci yod /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ma yin pa la gnod pa na de las gzhan pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod pa ci yod /
translated: If you undermine what is not the absence of an effect, then what harm is there to the probandum that is different from that?

original: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs te //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs te //
translated: If you accept the treatise,

original: rtsod pa la 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtsod pa la 'jug pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that you engage in debate?

original: des na rang nyid bstan bcos la gnas pa la ni de'i don gnod na nges par skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na rang nyid bstan bcos la gnas pa la ni de'i don gnod na nges par skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if one is abiding in the treatise, it is certainly faulty if one is harmed by its meaning.

original: ma yin te bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it has already been explained.

original: dri la sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu byas pa la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes so //üîΩrjes dpag rang gi spyod yul la //
analyzed: dri la sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu byas pa la yang skyon du 'gyur ro zhes so // rjes dpag rang gi spyod yul la //
translated: And it is faulty if one misapprehends the qualities of the earth element.üîΩInference is explainedüîΩnot to depend on scripture

original: lung la ltos pa med par bshad //
analyzed: lung la ltos pa med par bshad //
translated: with regard to its own domain.

original: des grub de ni legs par grub //
analyzed: des grub de ni legs par grub //
translated: When it is established, it is well established,

original: de tshe bstan bcos ltos ma yin //üîΩ'brel pa stobs la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi yul la /
analyzed: de tshe bstan bcos ltos ma yin // 'brel pa stobs la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi yul la /
translated: and then it does not depend on the treatise.

original: bstan bcos la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference that depends on the power of the relation does not depend on the treatise with regard to its own domain,

original: mngon sum bzhin du tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a valid cognition, like direct perception.

original: gang cung zad mthong ba de thams cad cig lung la ltos sam de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang lung la ltos sam ci /
analyzed: gang cung zad mthong ba de thams cad cig lung la ltos sam de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang lung la ltos sam ci /
translated: Does every little thing that is seen depend on scripture? Is inference also like that in that it depends on scripture?

original: ci ste bdag cag lta bu'i mngon sum ni nges par lung la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag cag lta bu'i mngon sum ni nges par lung la ltos pa yin te /
translated: But our direct perception definitely depends on scripture.

original: lung gis gnod na ni 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: lung gis gnod na ni 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: If it is contradicted by scripture, then it is just a mistake.

original: lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i tshig ni bdag cag lta bu'i mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha'i mig dang ldan pa'i tshig ni bdag cag lta bu'i mngon sum gyis gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: The words of one who has the divine eye are not contradicted by the direct perception of us ordinary people.

original: rab rib can gyis mthong bas ni cig shos kyis mthong pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong bas ni cig shos kyis mthong pa la gnod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The vision of one who has eye disease does not contradict the vision of one who has healthy eyes.

original: de ni bden te gal te /
analyzed: de ni bden te gal te /
translated: That is true, but if

original: lha yi mig can tshig kun gyi //
analyzed: lha yi mig can tshig kun gyi //
translated: the divine eye were the creator of all words,

original: byed po yin na tshig 'di rigs pa yin /
analyzed: byed po yin na tshig 'di rigs pa yin /
translated: then this statement would be reasonable.

original: de 'di 'ga' zhig yod kyang bdag cag gis //
analyzed: de 'di 'ga' zhig yod kyang bdag cag gis //
translated: But even if it exists, we do not know it,

original: de ni de bzhin gsal bas nges ma yin //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gsal bas nges ma yin //
translated: and it is not known by anyone else.

original: tshig phan tshun 'gal ba nyid kyis lung byed pa thams cad rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: tshig phan tshun 'gal ba nyid kyis lung byed pa thams cad rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: We understand that all scriptures are unreasonable because they are mutually contradictory.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin mod de lta na yang khyed cag pas kyang gzhan par ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin mod de lta na yang khyed cag pas kyang gzhan par ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though he is not omniscient, he is not like other people.

original: de lta na 'o na lung thams cad dang 'gal ba spangs dgos na don mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na lung thams cad dang 'gal ba spangs dgos na don mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: If that is so, then it is necessary to avoid all contradictions with scripture, and that is impossible.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, inference would not arise at all.

original: 'on te rang gi khas blangs pa'i lung gi bstan bcos dang 'gal ba nyid spang par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi khas blangs pa'i lung gi bstan bcos dang 'gal ba nyid spang par bya ba yin na /
translated: But if you are trying to avoid contradicting your own accepted scriptural treatises,

original: de lta na ni brtags nas khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni brtags nas khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: then you should examine them and accept them.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Even at the time of understanding, inference is not a valid cognition,

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ma spangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ma spangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not avoid contradicting the treatises.

original: de'i tshe bstan bcos khas blangs pa med pa nyid pas @156b 'gal ba spangs pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan bcos khas blangs pa med pa nyid pas @156b 'gal ba spangs pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: At that time, since you do not accept the treatises, what is the use of avoiding contradiction?

original: de lta na ni 'o na des grub ba'i bsgrub pa bya ba de ni legs par grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na des grub ba'i bsgrub pa bya ba de ni legs par grub pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, the object of affirmation established by that is well established.

original: grub pa ni phyis ma grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni phyis ma grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What is established does not become non-established later.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i lung khas blangs pas ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i lung khas blangs pas ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say it becomes non-established due to accepting a scripture that contradicts it,

original: 'o na ni bstan bcos thams cad dang 'gal ba spangs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni bstan bcos thams cad dang 'gal ba spangs pa de nyid do //
translated: then that is precisely the avoidance of contradicting all the treatises.

original: khas blangs pa la ltos nas 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin na zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs pa la ltos nas 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin na zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is in dependence on the opponent‚Äôs assertion that it is a contradiction, not otherwise,

original: khas blangs thams cad la ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: khas blangs thams cad la ci ste ma yin /
translated: then why is it not so in all cases of assertion?

original: brtag ni bzod pa nyid kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: brtag ni bzod pa nyid kyis so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because the opponent‚Äôs assertion is unacceptable,

original: de lta na ni 'o na brtag pa ni tshad ma yin la de nyid kyang des gnod pa'i phyir rang gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed slong ba'i tshul du 'di 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na brtag pa ni tshad ma yin la de nyid kyang des gnod pa'i phyir rang gsad pa'i phyir gshed byed slong ba'i tshul du 'di 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow that the opponent‚Äôs assertion is a valid cognition, and that very thing is undermined by it, so it would be like a demon summoned to destroy itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos nyid tshad mas 'gal ba'i phyir de'i tshe ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos nyid tshad mas 'gal ba'i phyir de'i tshe ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, the treatise itself is undermined by valid cognition, so at that time it is not to be relied upon.

original: des na de ni gnod par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te de'i tshe bstan bcos la ltos par bya ba ma yin na 'o na rtsod pa dor ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ni gnod par byed pa ma yin no // gal te de'i tshe bstan bcos la ltos par bya ba ma yin na 'o na rtsod pa dor ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a refutation.üîΩIf at that time the treatise is not to be relied upon, then the opponent‚Äôs assertion is abandoned.

original: de tshe rtsod dor 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: de tshe rtsod dor 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If you say that at that time the opponent‚Äôs assertion is abandoned,

original: de tshe khas blangs med phyir min //
analyzed: de tshe khas blangs med phyir min //
translated: it is not because it does not exist at that time.

original: 'di ni khas blangs thabs yin te //
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs thabs yin te //
translated: This is a method of assertion,

original: de tshe yod kyang yan lag min //
analyzed: de tshe yod kyang yan lag min //
translated: but even if it exists at that time, it is not a part of the argument.

original: bstan bcos la ma brten par rtsod pa mi byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos la ma brten par rtsod pa mi byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that one does not debate without relying on treatises,

original: de'i tshe khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time one has not accepted them.

original: khas len pa'i thabs ni brtags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khas len pa'i thabs ni brtags pa nyid yin no //
translated: The method of accepting them is precisely investigation.

original: ma brtags par de khas blangs so zhe na ni de'i tshe yod kyang yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: ma brtags par de khas blangs so zhe na ni de'i tshe yod kyang yan lag ma yin te /
translated: If one accepts them without investigating, then even if they exist, they are not limbs,

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are harmed by valid cognition.

original: brtag mi bzod pa'i bstan bcos ni de'i tshe gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag mi bzod pa'i bstan bcos ni de'i tshe gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A treatise that cannot withstand investigation does not harm at that time.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos gnod bar byed pa'i yan lag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe khas blangs pa'i bstan bcos gnod bar byed pa'i yan lag yin zhe na /
translated: Well, when is a treatise that is accepted a limb that harms?

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de ltar yul gnyis rnam dag na //
analyzed: de ltar yul gnyis rnam dag na //
translated: Thus, when the two objects are pure,

original: de ni bstan bcos yongs 'dzin par //
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos yongs 'dzin par //
translated: then is the time for accepting the treatise,

original: 'dod pa'i dus yin de yi tshe //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dus yin de yi tshe //
translated: at that time

original: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod par 'gyur //
translated: the treatise will harm.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gnyis pa yongs su dag pa na gal te de tsam gyis yongs su tshim gyis yongs su ma tshim pa de'i tshe bstan bcos 'dzin par 'dod pas naüîΩde ni bstan bcos len pa'i dus yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gnyis pa yongs su dag pa na gal te de tsam gyis yongs su tshim gyis yongs su ma tshim pa de'i tshe bstan bcos 'dzin par 'dod pas na de ni bstan bcos len pa'i dus yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the two objects, the directly perceptible and the imperceptible, are purified by direct perception and inference, if one is satisfied with just that, then one is not satisfied. At that time,üîΩone who wishes to uphold the treatise should

original: de nyid kyi tshe bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: take up the treatise at that time, because at that time the treatise is beneficial.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩdes grub don la de dang ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / des grub don la de dang ni //
translated: BecauseüîΩit is not suitable to think that

original: 'gal bar sems pa mi rung phyir //
analyzed: 'gal bar sems pa mi rung phyir //
translated: what is established by that contradicts it.

original: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba na //
analyzed: gnas gsum par ni 'pho ba na //
translated: When one moves to the third stage,

original: bstan bcos len par rigs ldan yin //üîΩbrtags nas bstan bcos @157a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos len par rigs ldan yin // brtags nas bstan bcos @157a * //
translated: one is suitable to take up the treatise.

original: khas blangs na bstan bcos de las rab tu grub pa'i don la de dang 'gal bar sems pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: khas blangs na bstan bcos de las rab tu grub pa'i don la de dang 'gal bar sems pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: If one examines and accepts the treatise, it is not suitable to think that what is well established by that treatise contradicts it.

original: gal te / bstan bcos de ni legs brtags na //
analyzed: gal te / bstan bcos de ni legs brtags na //
translated: If one examines that treatise well,

original: de ni ci ltar dam bca' gnod //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar dam bca' gnod //
translated: how does it contradict one's thesis?

original: de la slar yang brtag par bya yin te //
analyzed: de la slar yang brtag par bya yin te //
translated: It should be investigated further:

original: gal te rtogs na de ni brtags mi 'gyur ;
analyzed: gal te rtogs na de ni brtags mi 'gyur ;
translated: If it is understood, it is not investigated.

original: / de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis brtags te de'i yul ma yin pa gnas gsum pa la 'pho ba'i rgyu mtshan du bstan bcos khas len pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa'i yul la lung gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis brtags te de'i yul ma yin pa gnas gsum pa la 'pho ba'i rgyu mtshan du bstan bcos khas len pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa'i yul la lung gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is investigated by direct perception and inference, and since the reason for its transference to a third place, which is not its object, is accepted in the treatise, scripture does not invalidate the object of inference.

original: 'on te yang gang zhig ma dpyad par bstan bcos khas len na bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gang zhig ma dpyad par bstan bcos khas len na bstan bcos gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is accepted in the treatise without analysis, then since the treatise would invalidate it, there would be a fault in the thesis.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / der yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ni //
translated: There, the probandum and

original: med na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung la gnod nyid //
translated: the non-observation of the invariably concomitant are indeed to be refuted,

original: spang bar bya yi gzhan min te //
analyzed: spang bar bya yi gzhan min te //
translated: but not the other,

original: thug pa med par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to an infinite regress.

original: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs ba tsam gyis de'i don la gnod pa spang bar bya ba yin na dril sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu sgrub pas kyang nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas blangs ba tsam gyis de'i don la gnod pa spang bar bya ba yin na dril sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu sgrub pas kyang nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mere acceptance of a treatise were to eliminate the fault of contradicting the treatise, then it would be a fault to establish the qualities of a bell in a way that is contrary to the treatise.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'brel pa nyid kyis gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa gzhan dag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang 'brel pa nyid kyis gnod pa spang bar bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa gzhan dag gi ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to eliminate faults by means of the connection to the property to be proven, but not by means of other connections that are unrelated.

original: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs par rtsod na yang sun 'byin pa gtso bor byed pa tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos khas ma blangs par rtsod na yang sun 'byin pa gtso bor byed pa tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: Even if one does not accept the treatise, if one debates, one will be primarily concerned with refutation.

original: bstan bcos la mi brten ba ni med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos la mi brten ba ni med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because one who does not rely on the treatise will be nonexistent.

original: tshad mas grub pa khas len pa dang de bzhin du tshad mas ma grub pa khas len pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa khas len pa dang de bzhin du tshad mas ma grub pa khas len pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that which is established by valid knowledge, then one will not accept that which is not established by valid knowledge.

original: gang zhig gnas gsum par bstan bcos khas mi len pa de med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas gsum par bstan bcos khas mi len pa de med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One who does not accept the treatise in the third case is not nonexistent.

original: gnas gsum pa las gzhan du ni bstan bcos kyis ci bya /
analyzed: gnas gsum pa las gzhan du ni bstan bcos kyis ci bya /
translated: What use is a treatise for anything other than the three purposes?üîΩThus, who created this system

original: 'di ltar / dpyod pa kun la bstan bcos dag / gzung zhes lugs 'di gang gis byas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dpyod pa kun la bstan bcos dag / gzung zhes lugs 'di gang gis byas //
translated: that says, ‚ÄúA treatise should be accepted for all investigations‚Äù?

original: da ni grub mtha' med rnams kyis //
analyzed: da ni grub mtha' med rnams kyis //
translated: Now, those who have no philosophical position

original: du bas me ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: du bas me ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: do not understand fire from smoke.

original: gal te tshad ma thams cad grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas 'jug pa nyid yin na 'jig rten ba lang rdzi la sogs pas du ba las me rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma thams cad grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas 'jug pa nyid yin na 'jig rten ba lang rdzi la sogs pas du ba las me rtogs par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If all valid cognitions engage only after accepting a philosophical position, then even worldly people such as cow herders would not understand fire from smoke.

original: ci ste 'jig rten pha rol la nye bar mkho ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid bstan bcos khas len pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no @157b zhe na ;
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten pha rol la nye bar mkho ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid bstan bcos khas len pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no @157b zhe na ;
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúThe purpose of a treatise is only to accept that which is necessary for the world beyond, not anything else,‚Äù

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩbstan bcos khas blangs med par ni //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / bstan bcos khas blangs med par ni //
translated: that also is not so.

original: gal te de ni tshad ma yis //
analyzed: gal te de ni tshad ma yis //
translated: If that is a valid cognition without accepting a treatise,

original: des na de tshe bstan bcos ni //
analyzed: des na de tshe bstan bcos ni //
translated: then at that time,

original: sngon du gtong ba gang du dgos //
analyzed: sngon du gtong ba gang du dgos //
translated: where is the treatise necessary in advance?

original: gal te khas ma blangs na bstan bcos kyis gnod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khas ma blangs na bstan bcos kyis gnod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not accept it, he fears that the treatise will contradict it.

original: khas blangs na ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa shes te des na de de'i tshe ni bsgrub par mi bya ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: khas blangs na ni bstan bcos kyis gnod pa shes te des na de de'i tshe ni bsgrub par mi bya ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If he accepts it, he knows that the treatise contradicts it. Therefore, at that time, he should not establish it.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, because

original: tshad mas bsgrub pa ni mi 'dod kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas bsgrub pa ni mi 'dod kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: even though he does not want to establish it by means of a valid cognition, it is established.

original: bstan bcos ni de'i tshe gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos ni de'i tshe gtong ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, the treatise itself is abandoned.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyis ci ltar dor bar 'os she na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyis ci ltar dor bar 'os she na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it proper to abandon it by oneself?‚Äù

original: ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no connection.

original: de'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i yin no //
analyzed: de'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i yin no //
translated: It is his because it possesses his qualities.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / skye bo reng bur skyes gyur cing //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye bo reng bur skyes gyur cing //
translated: People are born as if they were logs.

original: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la //üîΩgrub mtha' mi bzad gdon de ni //
analyzed: yon tan nyes pa ma mthong la // grub mtha' mi bzad gdon de ni //
translated: They do not see good qualities and faults.üîΩAlas, who has bound

original: kye ma su yis bgos pa yin //
analyzed: kye ma su yis bgos pa yin //
translated: this demon, the unbearable tenets?

original: gal te rigs pas kyang grub pa'i mtha' dor bar mi nus na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rigs pas kyang grub pa'i mtha' dor bar mi nus na de'i tshe /
translated: If one cannot abandon tenets even through reasoning, then at that time,

original: 'di grub pa'i mtha' ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di grub pa'i mtha' ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not a tenet.‚Äù

original: grub mtha'i tshul gyis byis pa rnams kyi gdon mi bzad pa zhig ste /
analyzed: grub mtha'i tshul gyis byis pa rnams kyi gdon mi bzad pa zhig ste /
translated: It is a terrible demon for children,

original: de las thar bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las thar bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unable to escape from it.üîΩBut it is impossible to get rid of

original: lhan cig 'brel par skyes nyid las //üîΩyongs su dor bar mi nus na //
analyzed: lhan cig 'brel par skyes nyid las // yongs su dor bar mi nus na //
translated: that which is born together with one.üîΩHow can a person who is born

original: skye bo reng bur skyes bu dag / de ldan lhan cig ji ltar skyes //
analyzed: skye bo reng bur skyes bu dag / de ldan lhan cig ji ltar skyes //
translated: with that which is born together with him be born?üîΩSince there is no valid cognition,

analyzed: tshad ma spangs phyir yon tan dang // nyes pa rnam dbye gang la yod //

analyzed: de phyir rjes su dpag pa ni //

analyzed: bstan bcos khas len pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i rjes su dpag pa ci ltar nges par byed pa yin /

original: des na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dpe bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spang par mi nus pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: des na de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dpe bstan bcos dang 'gal ba spang par mi nus pa nyid do zhe na /

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /

original: 'di ltar / gal te dpe la bstan bcos kun //

analyzed: bstan pa sgrub byed 'gyur zhe na //

original: 'di ni 'jig rten 'das lugs yin //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten 'das lugs yin //

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni spang bar mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni spang bar mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: The contradiction with the treatises cannot be avoided.

original: bstan bcos nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bstan bcos nyid phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro ;

original: / thams cad tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: / thams cad tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Are they all valid cognitions or are they not?

original: re zhig tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: re zhig tshad ma yin na /
translated: If they are valid cognitions,

original: thams cad 'gal ba mi spongs te /
analyzed: thams cad 'gal ba mi spongs te /
translated: then all contradictions cannot be avoided,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually contradictory.

original: tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te skye bo thams cad kyi tshig dang 'gal ba ni rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtha' med pa dang ni 'gal ba @158a * //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te skye bo thams cad kyi tshig dang 'gal ba ni rtag tu yod pa'i phyir ro // mtha' med pa dang ni 'gal ba @158a * //
translated: Nor are they not valid cognitions, because the words of all people are always present.

original: spangs bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The contradiction with the infinite cannot be avoided.

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lam 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lam 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin no //
translated: This path is the way to transcend the world.

original: gal te chos can de nyid kyi chos nyid la gnod na /
analyzed: gal te chos can de nyid kyi chos nyid la gnod na /
translated: If the reality of that subject is harmed,

original: brjod pa la yang yid ches pa ci yod de gnod par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa la yang yid ches pa ci yod de gnod par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa srid pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: What reliability can there be in a statement that is contradicted? It is not possible for a proof to be a refutation.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: de lta yin na 'ga' yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'ga' yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then nothing would be a proof,

original: gcig bsgrub pa nyid kyis gdon mi za bar de las gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig bsgrub pa nyid kyis gdon mi za bar de las gzhan la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one thing is established, there is no doubt that the other is refuted.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'brel med chos ni ma grub pas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'brel med chos ni ma grub pas //
translated: Since a non-related phenomenon is not established,

original: ma grub pa ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be a non-establishment?

original: de grub yin na de sgrub brjod //
analyzed: de grub yin na de sgrub brjod //
translated: If it is established, then it is said to be a proof.

original: gtan tshigs skyon ldan ci ltar yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs skyon ldan ci ltar yin //
translated: How could the reason be faulty?

original: gal te 'brel pa med pa'i chos kyis gnod pa spang bar bya ba yin na gtan tshigs nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa med pa'i chos kyis gnod pa spang bar bya ba yin na gtan tshigs nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a non-related phenomenon is to be avoided as a refutation, then there would be no reason at all.

original: gal te gzhan la gnod kyang gzhan ci'i phyir mi 'grub du ba gcig gis kyang me dang grang ba'i reg pa yod pa dang med pa dag sgrub par byed par dmigs so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la gnod kyang gzhan ci'i phyir mi 'grub du ba gcig gis kyang me dang grang ba'i reg pa yod pa dang med pa dag sgrub par byed par dmigs so //
translated: Even if it refutes another, why would it not establish another? It is observed that even a single smoke establishes the existence of fire and the non-existence of cold touch.

original: bstan par bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir bsgrub pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir bsgrub pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: But it is not contradictory to prove that which is contradictory to what is to be proven.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan la yang 'gal ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan la yang 'gal ba mtshungs so //
translated: It is similar that there is no contradiction in the quality of space.

original: gal te gtan tshigs de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis sgrub par byed par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis sgrub par byed par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If that reason is a proof of both things and nonthings,

original: bstan par bya ba go ci ltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba go ci ltar bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how is the meaning that is contradictory to the treatise to be understood?

original: des na bstan bcos kyi don dang 'brel pa yang dpe la bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na bstan bcos kyi don dang 'brel pa yang dpe la bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the connection to the meaning of the treatise is to be shown by an example,

original: de'i chos nye bar blangs pa med par ni gtan tshigs las bsgrub bya rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i chos nye bar blangs pa med par ni gtan tshigs las bsgrub bya rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because without the property of the example being taken up, the probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / chos can chos ni ma lus pa //üîΩdpe bstan med pa kho nar ni //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / chos can chos ni ma lus pa // dpe bstan med pa kho nar ni //
translated: Because,üîΩWithout the property of the subject being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.

original: skye bo tshig dang dud sogs las //
analyzed: skye bo tshig dang dud sogs las //
translated: Without the property of the example being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the subject being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the example being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the subject being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the example being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the subject being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the example being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the subject being stated,

original: sems ldan me sogs rjes dpag byed //
analyzed: sems ldan me sogs rjes dpag byed //
translated: the probandum is not understood from the reason.üîΩWithout the property of the example being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.

original: bstan bcos las grub pa 'brel pa med pa'i chos lta re zhig zhog ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos las grub pa 'brel pa med pa'i chos lta re zhig zhog ste /
translated: Without the property of the subject being stated,üîΩthe probandum is not understood from the reason.

original: chos can de'i chos kyang 'ga' yang dpe la nye bar blangs pa med pa kho nar 'jig rten 'di dag dang du ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las sems pa can dang me la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos can de'i chos kyang 'ga' yang dpe la nye bar blangs pa med pa kho nar 'jig rten 'di dag dang du ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs las sems pa can dang me la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: The properties of the subject are also understood from the world itself and from the reason, such as smoke, without any example being employed.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos bkag ces te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos bkag ces te /
translated: The other properties are refuted.

original: me mi 'grub pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: me mi 'grub pa ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not that fire is not established.

original: bstan par bya bas mi rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya bas mi rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that the object to be established is not understood.

original: gzhan yang / bstan par bya ba mi 'dod kyang ngal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / bstan par bya ba mi 'dod kyang ngal te /
translated: Moreover, even if the object to be established is not accepted, it is established by the reason.üîΩThe meaning of the proof is

original: mi 'khrul pas @158b na ngo bo dang // rgyu dag sgrub par byed pa'i don //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pas @158b na ngo bo dang // rgyu dag sgrub par byed pa'i don //
translated: the nature and cause,

original: 'ga' yi smra ba la gnod pas //
analyzed: 'ga' yi smra ba la gnod pas //
translated: because the statement is not contradicted by any.

original: ngo bo nyid las ldog ma yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ldog ma yin //
translated: The nature is not reversed.

original: rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i don rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa'i don rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: The nature of objects that are related to their own causes

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pas ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: is not reversed by the desire of a person.

original: gtan tshigs las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mi 'khrul pa yin la de yang yod pas na ci ste sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: gtan tshigs las bsgrub bya 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mi 'khrul pa yin la de yang yod pas na ci ste sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
translated: The cause of establishing the probandum from the reason is non-deception, and since that exists, why is it not a proof?

original: 'on te 'di sgrub par byed pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te 'di sgrub par byed pa yin mod /
translated: But if it is a proof,

original: phyir rgol ba de go ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba de go ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: how does the opponent understand it?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid las ldog mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ldog mi 'gyur //
translated: It cannot be turned away from its nature.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya yi //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya yi //
translated: That is the desired probandum.

original: don dang med na mi 'byung bar //üîΩrtogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs des //
analyzed: don dang med na mi 'byung bar // rtogs pa gzhan dag gtan tshigs des //
translated: If the meaning is not established,üîΩhow can the other understanding

original: ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: be understood by that reason?

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa las //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa las //
translated: From unobstructed potentiality,

original: gzhan 'bras bu bskyed pa la ma zhugs pa'i rgyu ni bzlog par nus kyi shes par byed pa ni 'brel pa'i stobs kyis tshul gsum rtogs pa bskyed pa de nyid kyis bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'bras bu bskyed pa la ma zhugs pa'i rgyu ni bzlog par nus kyi shes par byed pa ni 'brel pa'i stobs kyis tshul gsum rtogs pa bskyed pa de nyid kyis bzlog par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: other than that, a cause that does not engage in producing an effect can be turned away, but the indicator, by the power of the relation, generates the understanding of the three modes, and by that very thing, it cannot be turned away.

original: rtags las gal te mi nges na //
analyzed: rtags las gal te mi nges na //
translated: If it is uncertain from the reason,

original: skyes bu mi 'dod bzhin du ni //
analyzed: skyes bu mi 'dod bzhin du ni //
translated: then the person, unwilling,

original: me yis tshig par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: me yis tshig par gyur pa yi //
translated: is burned by fire.üîΩThe suffering of being burned is completely turned away.

original: tshig pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu bzlog / de la mi 'khrul pa nyid rtogs pa nyid kyis ni de rtogs par mi byed ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig pa'i sdug bsngal rab tu bzlog / de la mi 'khrul pa nyid rtogs pa nyid kyis ni de rtogs par mi byed ba ma yin te /
translated: There, by the very understanding of non-deceptiveness, it is not that it is not made understood.

original: khyad par gyi khyad par can khyad par dang ldan par rtogs pas khyad par mi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi khyad par can khyad par dang ldan par rtogs pas khyad par mi rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In particular, since one realizes the special qualities of the special qualities, one does not fail to realize the special qualities.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The special is realized as endowed with the special, and not as not realized as the special, because it is not produced without that.

original: thams cad yin mod kyi 'on kyang rgol ba mi rigs pa byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad yin mod kyi 'on kyang rgol ba mi rigs pa byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is all, still the opponent acts improperly.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gtan tshigs brjod dam mi brjod kyang //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod dam mi brjod kyang //
translated: Even if the reason is stated or not stated,

original: 'gal na rgol bas ci zhig byas //üîΩnges brjod nyes pas bstan bcos la //
analyzed: 'gal na rgol bas ci zhig byas // nges brjod nyes pas bstan bcos la //
translated: if there is contradiction, what does the opponent do?üîΩThe treatise is not produced as a fault

original: gnod byed du ni de skyes min //üîΩgzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshig gi skyon yon gyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gnod byed du ni de skyes min // gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshig gi skyon yon gyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
translated: by the fault of stating the definite.

original: don gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference for the sake of another is governed by the faults and virtues of the words, but not by the meaning.

original: 'dir rgol bas ni nyes pa'i rigs 'ga' yang byas pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir rgol bas ni nyes pa'i rigs 'ga' yang byas pa med do //
translated: Here the opponent has not committed any type of fault.

original: bstan bcos gnod par byas so zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos gnod par byas so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the treatise is damaged,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: ma brjod kyang gtan tshigs nyid bstan bcos kyis gnod par byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: ma brjod kyang gtan tshigs nyid bstan bcos kyis gnod par byed pa yin no ;
translated: Even if it is not stated, the reason itself damages the treatise.

original: / ci'i phyir de lta bu'i gtan tshigs 'god ce na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir de lta bu'i gtan tshigs 'god ce na /
translated: Why is such a reason stated?

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la mi gnod par mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do //üîΩci ste kha rog nyid du mi 'dug ce na ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la mi gnod par mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa ni 'ga' yang med do // ci ste kha rog nyid du mi 'dug ce na ma yin no //
translated: There is no proof of impermanence that does not contradict the qualities of space, etc.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mi brjod pa @159a * //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag mi brjod pa @159a * //
translated: If you say that the reason is not stated because it is well known, that is not so.

original: ni shin tu cher tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni shin tu cher tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a great fault not to state a part of the proof.

original: bstan par bya ba yang gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba yang gdon mi za bar rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: And the probandum must be understood without a doubt.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rgol ba la ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rgol ba la ni skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent here has no fault.

original: gnod byed brjod phyir skyon ce na //
analyzed: gnod byed brjod phyir skyon ce na //
translated: If you say that there is a fault because the refutation is stated,

original: gal te ma brjod na de ci //üîΩgnod pa min nam mi rigs byed //
analyzed: gal te ma brjod na de ci // gnod pa min nam mi rigs byed //
translated: if it is not stated, then what?üîΩIs it not a fault not to state the refutation?

original: min te ci las skyon can yin //
analyzed: min te ci las skyon can yin //
translated: No, because it is not a fault to state what is not a fault.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba brjod pa la yang skyon yong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gtan tshigs ltar snang ba brjod pa la yang skyon yong pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that there would be no fault in stating a fallacious reason.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang rang nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rgol ba la nyes pa ci yod /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang rang nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir rgol ba la nyes pa ci yod /
translated: Since a fallacious reason is itself like that, what fault is there in the opponent?

original: de yang des brjod pa'i nyes pas nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang des brjod pa'i nyes pas nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not that one is at fault because of the fault stated by that,

original: rang nyid nges ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid nges ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is oneself certain.

original: gtan tshigs brjod rung ma brjod rung //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod rung ma brjod rung //
translated: Whether a reason is stated or not,

original: ma grub rgol bas 'dir ci byas //
analyzed: ma grub rgol bas 'dir ci byas //
translated: what does the opponent do here?

original: de yi brjod pa'i nyes pa yis //
analyzed: de yi brjod pa'i nyes pa yis //
translated: By the fault stated by that,

original: de ni ma grub 'gal ba min //
analyzed: de ni ma grub 'gal ba min //
translated: it is not that it is not established or contradictory.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang gzhan dag la //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang gzhan dag la //
translated: because other fallacious reasons

original: rang 'dod nyid ni sgrub med phyir //
analyzed: rang 'dod nyid ni sgrub med phyir //
translated: do not establish one's own desire.

original: don med brjod pas skyon 'gyur na //
analyzed: don med brjod pas skyon 'gyur na //
translated: If one is at fault by stating the meaningless,

original: de sgrub phyir na 'dir ma yin //
analyzed: de sgrub phyir na 'dir ma yin //
translated: it is not so here in order to establish that.

original: de la sgrub pa'i don du sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya ba la de sgrub par byed pa ma yin brjod pa ni don med pa brjod pa'i phyir na skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i don du sgrub par byed pa brjod par bya ba la de sgrub par byed pa ma yin brjod pa ni don med pa brjod pa'i phyir na skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, if one were to state a proof for the sake of proving that, since it is not a statement that proves that, it would be a fault because it is a statement that is meaningless.

original: don dang ldan par brjod pa'i skabs su don med par brjod pa ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dang ldan par brjod pa'i skabs su don med par brjod pa ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: When one states something meaningful, if one states something meaningless, it is meaningless.

original: 'dir ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa brjod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: Here, since one states a proof for the probandum, there is no fault.

original: 'dir ni / ma brjod pa nyid skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni / ma brjod pa nyid skyon yin no //
translated: Here, not stating is a fault.

original: 'dir yang ma brjod pa skyon yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma brjod pa skyon yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Here, if not stating is a fault, it is not so.

original: sgrub par byed pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof also exists.

original: 'dir ni bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan bcos kyi don nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa mi srid do //
translated: Here, it is impossible for the meaning of the treatise to be harmed by the quality of space.

original: gal te gtan tshigs kyis bstan bcos kyi don la gnod la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ci ltar sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs kyis bstan bcos kyi don la gnod la mi rtag pa nyid kyang ci ltar sgrub par byed de /
translated: If the reason harms the meaning of the treatise, how does impermanence prove it?

original: de nyid kyis ma des pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ma des pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not established by that itself.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: gal te la lar bstan bcos 'ga' //
analyzed: gal te la lar bstan bcos 'ga' //
translated: If some treatises are not reasonable,

original: rigs min pas na rigs smra ba //
analyzed: rigs min pas na rigs smra ba //
translated: then the one who speaks reasonably

original: gzhan pa dag kyang dgag byed ces //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag kyang dgag byed ces //
translated: should refute the others,

original: bya ba rgyal rigs lugs yin no //
analyzed: bya ba rgyal rigs lugs yin no //
translated: this is the way of the king.

original: bstan bcos mtha' dag gi don 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos mtha' dag gi don 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of all treatises is not contradictory,

original: bstan bcos 'ga' zhig nyid la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos 'ga' zhig nyid la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that exists in some treatises themselves.

original: 'brel pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa ma yin @159b pa 'di la 'gal ba ci yod //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa ma yin @159b pa 'di la 'gal ba ci yod //
translated: What contradiction is there in this, that what is related and what is not related are established and not established?

original: mi rigs pa bkag pas rigs pa yang dgag pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyal po'i dag yin no //
analyzed: mi rigs pa bkag pas rigs pa yang dgag pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyal po'i dag yin no //
translated: This is the way of the king: by refuting the unreasonable, the reasonable is also refuted.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / don kun mtshungs par byas pas ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / don kun mtshungs par byas pas ni //
translated: because all meanings are the same,

original: sgrub byed brjod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: sgrub byed brjod par nus ma yin //
translated: the proof cannot be stated.üîΩTherefore, this presentation of the probandum

original: des na kun du bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed gzhag pa 'di nyams 'gyur //
analyzed: des na kun du bsgrub bya dang // sgrub byed gzhag pa 'di nyams 'gyur //
translated: and the proof is undermined.

original: don thams dad dang mi 'gal bar ni sgrub par byed pa 'ga' yang brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: don thams dad dang mi 'gal bar ni sgrub par byed pa 'ga' yang brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Because it is not contradictory to all meanings, no proof can be stated at all.

original: skabs kyi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa tsam nyid la ltos par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa tsam nyid la ltos par byas pa yin no //
translated: It is only in relation to the mere connection with the probandum of the context that it is called a probative reason.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible.

original: bstan bcos kyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don dang mi 'gal ba nyid bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the case that it must not contradict the meaning of the treatise,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so,

original: khyad par med pas gzhan la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pas gzhan la yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be the same for others, since there is no difference.

original: ci ste bstan bcos kyi 'gal ba yang spang bar bya ba yin na de lta na ni 'ga' yang sgrub par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur bas na thams cad du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste bstan bcos kyi 'gal ba yang spang bar bya ba yin na de lta na ni 'ga' yang sgrub par byed pa nyid yin par mi 'gyur bas na thams cad du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the contradiction with the treatise is also to be avoided, then nothing would be a probative reason, and so the entire system of probanda and probative reasons would be destroyed.

original: 'o na ni ci'i phyir bstan bcos khas len zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni ci'i phyir bstan bcos khas len zhe na /
translated: Well then, why accept the treatise?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: 'dir 'di nyid sgrub par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di nyid sgrub par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: but here it is this very treatise that is intended to be established.

original: dang po bstan bcos khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po bstan bcos khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: At first, it is not to be accepted.

original: byas pa yin na yang tshad ma dang 'gal bas phyis kyang dor ba nyid dge'o //
analyzed: byas pa yin na yang tshad ma dang 'gal bas phyis kyang dor ba nyid dge'o //
translated: Even if it is accepted, it is better to abandon it later, because it contradicts valid cognition.

original: pha ro la po dag 'dod pa ni dam bcas pa ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha ro la po dag 'dod pa ni dam bcas pa ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: are asserted by the opponent.

original: des na bstan bcos khas blangs nas 'gal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na bstan bcos khas blangs nas 'gal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, having accepted the treatise, it is not contradictory,

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas rtsod ba byed la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas rtsod ba byed la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: because one enters into debate having accepted the tenets.

original: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bkag kyang gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin na 'o na ci ltar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can sgrub par byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur der yang sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid bkag kyang gtan tshigs kyi skyon ma yin na 'o na ci ltar 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can sgrub par byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur der yang sgrub par byed pa /
translated: If, although the quality of space is refuted, it is not a fault of the reason, then how could it be a fault of the proof that it is nonerroneously contradictory?üîΩIn that case, the proof would be that it is contradictory to the meaning established by the opponent, and here also the fault is that it is contradictory to the meaning established by the treatise.

original: gzhan gyis rab tu grub pa'i don dang 'gal ba las nye bar 'gyur ba yin la 'dir yang bstan bcos las grub pa'i don dang 'gal ba nyid skyon yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rab tu grub pa'i don dang 'gal ba las nye bar 'gyur ba yin la 'dir yang bstan bcos las grub pa'i don dang 'gal ba nyid skyon yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: 'di ltar / chos can gcig la 'gal ba dag / mi rung phyir na 'gal nges la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos can gcig la 'gal ba dag / mi rung phyir na 'gal nges la //
translated: it is not suitable for two contradictory properties to belong to a single basis.üîΩTherefore, the certainty of contradiction

original: gnod 'gyur 'dir ni de 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: gnod 'gyur 'dir ni de 'dra ba'i //
translated: is the fault that is contradictory to the meaning established by the treatise.üîΩHere, the fault is that it is contradictory to the meaning established by the treatise.

original: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don la mi 'khrul pa gnyi ga yang stobs mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i don la mi 'khrul pa gnyi ga yang stobs mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: Nonerrone contradiction and mutual contradiction are both equal in strength,

original: gnyis yang lung la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis yang lung la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are based on scripture.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa yin la /
translated: Inference engages its object by the power of fact.

original: lud ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: lud ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Scripture is not like that.

original: des na de dag ni @160a * //
analyzed: des na de dag ni @160a * //
translated: Therefore, they are not

original: 'gal ba'i mi 'khrul pa bzhin du phan tshun gnod pa byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i mi 'khrul pa bzhin du phan tshun gnod pa byed pa ma yin no //
translated: mutually contradictory like nonerrone contradiction.

original: gnyi ga yang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Neither is a proof.

original: 'gal ba dag chos can gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag chos can gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for contradictions to be the same basis.

original: bstan bcos ni 'gal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ltos te tshad ma nyid ma yin pas de'i don gnod par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni 'gal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ltos te tshad ma nyid ma yin pas de'i don gnod par bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Since a treatise is not a valid cognition in reliance on a contradictory inference, its meaning is to be refuted.

original: 'gal ba'i mi 'khrul pa bzhin du gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i mi 'khrul pa bzhin du gnod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a refutation like nonerrone contradiction.

original: tshad ma'i stobs kyis gzung ba ma yin ba'i bstan bcos ni tshad ma nyid yin pa bkag pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma'i stobs kyis gzung ba ma yin ba'i bstan bcos ni tshad ma nyid yin pa bkag pa nyid do //
translated: A treatise that is not apprehended by the power of valid cognition is refuted as being itself a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi phyogs nye bar bkod pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi phyogs nye bar bkod pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the opponent is unable to bear the statement of a reason that is contradictory to the nonerroneous.

original: / ci ste dbang po las 'das pas byas pa'i bstan bcos de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod /
analyzed: / ci ste dbang po las 'das pas byas pa'i bstan bcos de ci ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod /
translated: But if the treatise that is beyond the senses is so, how is it that inference contradicts it?

original: des na des gegs byas ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na des gegs byas ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the inference that is obstructed by it is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba bzhin du 'dir yang skyon du zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba bzhin du 'dir yang skyon du zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because of the equality of power, just as there is a contradiction with the nonerroneous, here also there is a fault.üîΩThat is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: Because:

original: 'di ltar / gal te 'gal ba'i rjes dpag kyang //
