analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te 'gal ba'i rjes dpag kyang //
translated: If the inference that contradicts

original: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod gyur na //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis ni gnod gyur na //
translated: is obstructed by the treatise,

original: tshad ma mtha' dag nyams 'gyur te //
analyzed: tshad ma mtha' dag nyams 'gyur te //
translated: then all valid cognitions will fail,

original: lung nyid 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur //
analyzed: lung nyid 'ba' zhig lus par 'gyur //
translated: and only scripture will remain.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa mtha' dag bstan bcos kyi gnod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pas bstan bcos kyi don gzhan la sgrub pa'i phyir lung dam bca' bar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa mtha' dag bstan bcos kyi gnod pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pas bstan bcos kyi don gzhan la sgrub pa'i phyir lung dam bca' bar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If all inferences are invalidated by the treatise, then how could a scripture be established as a thesis by another inference?

original: rjes su dpag pa 'am gzhan bstan bcos kyis mi gnod pa'i tshad gang yin pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'am gzhan bstan bcos kyis mi gnod pa'i tshad gang yin pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no valid cognition that is not invalidated by another treatise or inference,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni phan tshun bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir dang / me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid kyi bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni phan tshun bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir dang / me yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang stong pa nyid kyi bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inferences such as permanence and impermanence and so on are mutually invalidated by treatises, and because the statement ‚ÄúFire exists‚Äù and so on is invalidated by the treatise on emptiness.

original: 'on te de tshad ma ma yin pa ci ltar rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te de tshad ma ma yin pa ci ltar rjes su dpag pa'i gnod par byed pa yin /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition, how could it invalidate an inference?

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pas tshad ma yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pas tshad ma yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is a valid cognition that invalidates an inference, but not all are like that.

original: bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba khyed kyi phyogs ma yin nam des na khyod kyi phyogs dor ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos kyis gnod pa'i rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba khyed kyi phyogs ma yin nam des na khyod kyi phyogs dor ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Is it not your position that the inference that is undermined by treatise is not a valid cognition? Therefore, it is untenable that you abandon your position.

original: 'on te brtags pa tshad ma yin pas na des gnod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brtags pa tshad ma yin pas na des gnod par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because investigation is a valid cognition, it undermines,

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid brtag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid brtag pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt inference itself an investigation?

original: des na bstan bcos des gnod par brtag pa ci ltar bstan @160b bcos tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: des na bstan bcos des gnod par brtag pa ci ltar bstan @160b bcos tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, how could the treatise that investigates and undermines be a valid cognition?

original: de la med pa de la yod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la med pa de la yod par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that which makes that which does not exist there exist there.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid tsa ba bstan ba'i phyir tshad ma yin pas des gnod pa'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir na de'i gnyen po ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid tsa ba bstan ba'i phyir tshad ma yin pas des gnod pa'i phyir bstan bcos tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir na de'i gnyen po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because inference that is preceded by direct perception is itself a valid cognition, it is a valid cognition that teaches the treatise. Therefore, because it undermines, the treatise is not a valid cognition, and therefore it is not its antidote.

original: des na 'dir yang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like nonerroneous contradiction, it is not so here.

original: des na nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa dang / lhan cig pa'i mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin pa dang / lhan cig pa'i mi rtag pa sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the proof of the non-eternality of that which is simultaneous with the quality of space is a proof,

original: skyon dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not a fault.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba ni rtag pa dang nge med par sgrub par byed pas gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid de de yod pa dang med pa dag chos can gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba ni rtag pa dang nge med par sgrub par byed pas gtan tshigs ma yin pa nyid de de yod pa dang med pa dag chos can gcig la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-erroneous contradiction is not a logical proof, because the existence and non-existence of that [quality of space] are impossible in one substratum.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir chos can gcig la sgrub pa la skyon gal yod /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med pa ni mi rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin pa'i phyir chos can gcig la sgrub pa la skyon gal yod /
translated: The non-existence of the quality of space is not contradictory to impermanence, so there is no fault in proving one in a single substratum.üîΩBut if you say:

original: 'on te / de dag gnod bya gnod byed ni //
analyzed: 'on te / de dag gnod bya gnod byed ni //
translated: Even though they are not the object and means of refutation,

original: min yang bstan bcos don slad phyir //
analyzed: min yang bstan bcos don slad phyir //
translated: they are stated for the sake of the treatise.üîΩIf you say:

original: 'brel ba med kyang gnod ce na //
analyzed: 'brel ba med kyang gnod ce na //
translated: Even though they are not related, they are contradictory.

original: thams cad thams cad kyis gnod 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyis gnod 'gyur //
translated: Then everything would contradict everything.

original: skabs kyi gtan tshigs de nyid dam gzhan gyi dri la sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu byed pa'i phyir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi gtan tshigs de nyid dam gzhan gyi dri la sa'i yon tan phyin ci log tu byed pa'i phyir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the reason of the context, it would also be the case that the qualities of earth would be misconstrued as the qualities of the other.

original: 'brel yod des na de nyid la //
analyzed: 'brel yod des na de nyid la //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is related to that,üîΩbut it is not undermined,‚Äù

original: gnod 'gyur zhe na ma yin te //üîΩgtan tshigs kun rang bsgrub bya la //
analyzed: gnod 'gyur zhe na ma yin te // gtan tshigs kun rang bsgrub bya la //
translated: that is not so,

original: yon tan nyes pa dpyad phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan nyes pa dpyad phyir ro //
translated: because all reasons are examined for their good and bad qualities in relation to the probandum.

original: gal te chos can de la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid de /
analyzed: gal te chos can de la nam mkha'i yon tan nyid de /
translated: If the quality of space exists in that subject, it is related because of existing.üîΩEven if that is the case, it is not the probandum because it is not the context.

original: yod pa yin ba'i phyir 'brel ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang bsgrub bya ma yin te skabs ma yin ba'i phyir skabs ma yin pa yang gnod pas skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa yin ba'i phyir 'brel ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang bsgrub bya ma yin te skabs ma yin ba'i phyir skabs ma yin pa yang gnod pas skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not the context, but it is not undermined,‚Äù that is not so,

original: gtan tshigs thams cad ni rang gi bsgrub bya la ltos te skyon yon bsam par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad ni rang gi bsgrub bya la ltos te skyon yon bsam par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all reasons are asserted to be examined for their good and bad qualities in relation to the probandum.

original: de rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi mthun pa med kyang gal te de las gzhan 'brel pa med pa la gnod pas bstan bcos la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nyes bas 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs gzhan kyis kyang chos can gzhan du yang gnod
analyzed: de rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi mthun pa med kyang gal te de las gzhan 'brel pa med pa la gnod pas bstan bcos la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nyes bas 'gyur na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs gzhan kyis kyang chos can gzhan du yang gnod
translated: Even though there is no contradiction in the probandum, if it were a fault because it is a characteristic that contradicts the treatise, then at that time, the other reason would also be a fault that contradicts the other subject.

original: pa byed pa'i skyon mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: pa byed pa'i skyon mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i //
translated: If the pervasion is not established,

original: 'brel pa de ni 'dir rtogs med //
analyzed: 'brel pa de ni 'dir rtogs med //
translated: the connection is not realized here.üîΩHere, the only fault that contradicts the treatise

original: 'dir ni bstan bcos gnod 'ba' zhig / skyon yin de gzhan byas la'ang mtshungs //
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan bcos gnod 'ba' zhig / skyon yin de gzhan byas la'ang mtshungs //
translated: is the same for others who commit it.

original: bsgrub bya'i khyab par byed pa med par bsgrub pa ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i khyab par byed pa med par bsgrub pa ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The proof that lacks the pervader of the probandum is to be abandoned.

original: bsgrub par @161a * //
analyzed: bsgrub par @161a * //
translated: If the probandum is not established,

original: bya ba 'grub pa med pa na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gnod na ni de med na khyab bar bya ba yang ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba 'grub pa med pa na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de la gnod na ni de med na khyab bar bya ba yang ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the non-occurrence of what is to be established is contradicted, because if that is absent, the pervaded is also negated.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med na ni bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid ma yin te des na de med kyang bsgrub bya 'gog pa ma yan no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid med na ni bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid ma yin te des na de med kyang bsgrub bya 'gog pa ma yan no //
translated: If the quality of space does not exist, then it is not the case that the probandum does not occur without it. Therefore, even if it does not exist, the probandum is not refuted.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bstan bcos khas blangs phyir //
translated: If you accept the treatise,

original: bstan bcos mthong ba ma lus bsgrub //
analyzed: bstan bcos mthong ba ma lus bsgrub //
translated: then you must accept all that the treatise teaches.

original: dpe dang gtan tshigs ma grub smra //
analyzed: dpe dang gtan tshigs ma grub smra //
translated: You say that the example and reason are not established,

original: dam bca' bar ni thal bar 'gyur //üîΩtshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad pa byed pa na re /
analyzed: dam bca' bar ni thal bar 'gyur // tshad ma kun las btus pa'i bshad pa byed pa na re /
translated: but the consequence applies to you.üîΩThe author of the NyƒÅyamukha says:

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos su mthong ba ma lus pa bsgrub bya yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos su mthong ba ma lus pa bsgrub bya yin te /
translated: If you accept the treatise, then you must accept all that the treatise teaches.

original: de lta ma yin na bstan bcos khas blangs pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bstan bcos khas blangs pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: If it were not so, then accepting the treatise would be pointless.

original: de'i don mi sgrub na ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa 'gar yang nye bar mkho ba ma yin zhing khas blangs par yang mi 'os so //
analyzed: de'i don mi sgrub na ni bstan bcos khas blangs pa 'gar yang nye bar mkho ba ma yin zhing khas blangs par yang mi 'os so //
translated: If you do not establish its meaning, then accepting the treatise would never be useful, and it would not be appropriate to accept it.

original: rang dbang du tshad ma yin na ni tshad mas cung zad kyang byar med do //
analyzed: rang dbang du tshad ma yin na ni tshad mas cung zad kyang byar med do //
translated: If it is a valid means of knowledge that is independent, then it has nothing to do with valid knowledge.

original: des na bstan bcos khas blangs nas de'i don grub par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na bstan bcos khas blangs nas de'i don grub par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, having accepted the treatise, one should establish its meaning.

original: des na de dang 'gal ba ni skyo na nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na de dang 'gal ba ni skyo na nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, that which contradicts it is a fault.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bstan pa dag kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe bstan pa dag kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The statement of a nonestablished reason and example would also be a thesis,

original: de dag kyang res 'ga' bstan bcos kyi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang res 'ga' bstan bcos kyi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would sometimes be the meaning of the treatise.

original: 'gyur med nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gyur med nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with saying they are invariable?

original: thams cad dam bca' ba nyid du 'gyur te des na ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad dam bca' ba nyid du 'gyur te des na ma grub pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Everything would be a thesis, and therefore it would not be possible to state the faults of nonestablishment and so on.

original: gal te bstan bcos kyi don ma yin pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba yin pas de la ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos kyi don ma yin pa gang yin pa de gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba yin pas de la ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that because whatever is not the meaning of the treatise should be stated as a reason, it would be possible to state the faults of nonestablishment and so on,

original: ma yin te de yang rang gi kha nas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de yang rang gi kha nas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because that is also accepted by us.

original: 'on te rang gi kha nas khas blangs pa'i dam bca' ba ma yin na gzhan gyi kha nas khas blangs pa ma yin par gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi kha nas khas blangs pa'i dam bca' ba ma yin na gzhan gyi kha nas khas blangs pa ma yin par gsal ba nyid do //
translated: But if it is not a thesis that is accepted by oneself, then it is clear that it is not accepted by another.

original: gzhan bye brag la sogs pa ltar na yang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan bye brag la sogs pa ltar na yang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And if it is like other theses, such as the Vai≈õe·π£ika, then it is a thesis that teaches the probandum.

original: ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would also be a teaching of a proof of what is not established.

original: de'i ltar na yang gal te bstan bcos kyi don bstan pa ma yin pa dam bca' bar mi 'gyur yang /
analyzed: de'i ltar na yang gal te bstan bcos kyi don bstan pa ma yin pa dam bca' bar mi 'gyur yang /
translated: In that case, even if the meaning of the treatise is not a thesis,

original: bstan pa ni 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: it would still be a teaching.

original: 'di ltar rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: In this way, from the explanation,

original: dam bca' ba ni lung yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni lung yin par brjod do //
translated: it is said that a thesis is scripture.

original: gal te dam bcas pa gang yin pa de ni lung @161b yin gyi lung ni dam bca' ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa gang yin pa de ni lung @161b yin gyi lung ni dam bca' ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that whatever is a thesis is scripture, but scripture is not a thesis, that is not so.

original: dam bca' ba ni lung gi don ston pas lung yin gyi /
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni lung gi don ston pas lung yin gyi /
translated: A thesis is scripture because it teaches the meaning of scripture,

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by its own nature.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa dam bca' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa dam bca' ba yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs la sogs pa dam bca' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since the thesis is the statement of what is to be established, the unestablished reason and so on would be the thesis,

original: de yang lung gi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang lung gi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the meaning of the scripture.

original: bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag bsgrub bya yin pa de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos kyi don mtha' dag bsgrub bya yin pa de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the entire meaning of the treatise is what is to be established.

original: de ltar yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du brjod pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang sgrub par byed pa nyid du brjod pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin te /
translated: However, that which is stated as the means of establishing that is not the thesis,

original: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not asserted to be what is to be established.

original: rab tu byed pa rigs pa'i sgo las /üîΩde la yang rang nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa 'gal ba'i don gyis ma bsal ba ni phyogs yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa rigs pa'i sgo las / de la yang rang nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa 'gal ba'i don gyis ma bsal ba ni phyogs yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Prakara·πáa says:üîΩ‚ÄúThat which is itself asserted to be what is to be established, but is not cleared by the meaning of the refutation, is the subject.‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'dod phugs nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'dod phugs nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is stated as the means of establishing that is not the ultimate assertion.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni las yin na sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa ni las ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni las yin na sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa ni las ma yin te /
translated: If what is to be established is the object, then that which is asserted to be the means of establishing that is not the object.

original: dper na 'o mas 'bras chan bca' bo zhes bya ba la 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'o mas 'bras chan bca' bo zhes bya ba la 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the milk in the statement, ‚ÄúCook the rice with milk.‚Äù

original: tshad ma kun las btus pa las kyang rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma kun las btus pa las kyang rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the Compendium of Valid Cognition, it says, ‚ÄúOnly in terms of its own nature,‚Äù because it is ascertained.

original: rigs pa can bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni dam bca' ba 'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs pa can bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni dam bca' ba 'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement of the logical reason is the thesis.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du zhes dngos po gtso bor byed pa'i nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du zhes dngos po gtso bor byed pa'i nges par gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the thing is the primary focus, it is ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni dam bca' ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the statement of the probandum is not the thesis.

original: 'di la brjod pa /üîΩgal te sgrub byed nyid brjod pa //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa / gal te sgrub byed nyid brjod pa //
translated: To this, we reply:üîΩIf the statement of the logical reason

original: ma yin 'dod pa mos phyir na //üîΩbsgrub bya rigs pas thob pa ni //
analyzed: ma yin 'dod pa mos phyir na // bsgrub bya rigs pas thob pa ni //
translated: is not the thesis, because it is asserted,üîΩthen the statement of the probandum,

original: tshig las ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig las ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: which is obtained through reasoning, is not the thesis.

original: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gal te rigs pa yin na de ci ltar rigs pa thob pa tshig las ldog rigs pa ston pa'i tshig ni rigs pa nyid 'gog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di gal te rigs pa yin na de ci ltar rigs pa thob pa tshig las ldog rigs pa ston pa'i tshig ni rigs pa nyid 'gog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If this reason is correct, then how could it be correct to reverse the words? The words that teach the reason do not refute the reason itself.

original: 'on te tshig gis bstan pa'i rigs pa yang sgrub bar byed pa nyid du bstan la bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tshig gis bstan pa'i rigs pa yang sgrub bar byed pa nyid du bstan la bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if the reason taught by the words is taught as the proof, then it is not the proof of what is to be proven.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de lta yin na 'di gnyis ni //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di gnyis ni //
translated: If that were so, these two

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul can 'gyur te //üîΩbstan bcos khas blangs phyir zhes dang // de bzhin 'dod sogs brjod de'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul can 'gyur te // bstan bcos khas blangs phyir zhes dang // de bzhin 'dod sogs brjod de'o //
translated: would be nonerroneous contradictions.üîΩBecause of accepting the treatise,üîΩand likewise because of stating desire, etc.

original: gal te 'dod pa brjod pa la sogs pa'i rigs pas sgrub pa byed pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bsgrub pa dang de bzhin du bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis bsgrub par @162a * //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa brjod pa la sogs pa'i rigs pas sgrub pa byed pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bsgrub pa dang de bzhin du bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis bsgrub par @162a * //
translated: If the proof by the reason of stating desire, etc. is the proof of what is not to be proven, and likewise this because of accepting the treatise is the proof of what is not to be proven,

original: bya ba nyid yin pa de lta na gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrub pa de gnyis the tshom skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba nyid yin pa de lta na gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrub pa de gnyis the tshom skyed par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were an object of affirmation, then two mutually contradictory objects would be affirmed in regard to a single basis, and that would generate doubt.

original: de lta yin dang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mthong ba sgrub par byed ba nyid du 'dod pa yin yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos la mthong ba sgrub par byed ba nyid du 'dod pa yin yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then the statement ‚Äúbecause of accepting the treatise‚Äù would not be a proof, and therefore, even though the treatise is asserted to be a proof through seeing, how could it be an object of affirmation?

original: 'on te bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin la de ltar na rgol bas 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bstan bcos khas blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin la de ltar na rgol bas 'dod pas bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the statement ‚Äúbecause of accepting the treatise‚Äù is not a reason, then the proponent‚Äôs assertion is the object of affirmation, but it is not asserted to be a proof.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te mi 'dod sgrub min na /üîΩrgol ba mi 'dod chos gzhan yang //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod sgrub min na / rgol ba mi 'dod chos gzhan yang //
translated: If what is not asserted is not established,üîΩthen other phenomena that are not asserted by the proponent

original: sgrub min de tshe bsgrub bya ba //
analyzed: sgrub min de tshe bsgrub bya ba //
translated: are not established.

original: min la gnod pas ci zhig 'gal //
analyzed: min la gnod pas ci zhig 'gal //
translated: What contradiction is there in saying that what is not to be established is refuted?

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang rgol bas 'dod pa ni ma yin te des na bsgrub bya ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid kyang rgol bas 'dod pa ni ma yin te des na bsgrub bya ma yin no //
translated: The opponent does not assert that sound is a quality of space, and so it is not the probandum.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa skabs dor nas skabs ma yin pa la /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa skabs dor nas skabs ma yin pa la /
translated: Having abandoned the context of the realized, you have entered into a context that is not the realized.

original: phugs kyis 'dod pa ci ltar byed ;üîΩ/ gal te bstan bcos khas blangs nas rang gis brjod pa'i gtan tshig kyis 'gal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: phugs kyis 'dod pa ci ltar byed ; / gal te bstan bcos khas blangs nas rang gis brjod pa'i gtan tshig kyis 'gal bar 'gyur na /
translated: What is the point of this?

original: gdon mi za bar nyes ba can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar nyes ba can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If, having accepted the treatise, one contradicts oneself with the reasonings that one has stated, then one will certainly be at fault.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, that is not so.

original: rang nyid dang phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir skyon yong pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang nyid dang phyir rgol ba'i 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i phyir skyon yong pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that it is not the case that one incurs a fault by proving what one wishes to prove and what the opponent wishes to prove.

original: 'on te tshad ma dang yang 'gal ba yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma dang yang 'gal ba yin te ;
translated: But it is contradictory to valid knowledge.

original: gal te sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin na skyes pa'i gnas nyid du thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin na skyes pa'i gnas nyid du thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If sound is not a quality of space, then it would be heard in the place of its origin.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid yin na ni de dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan du yang thos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid yin na ni de dang ldan pa'i phyir gzhan du yang thos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a quality of space, then it would be heard elsewhere because it would be connected to space.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de nyid du de 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid du de 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs bzhin no //
translated: because it is apprehended in that very place, like visible form.

original: thag ring na 'dug pas ci phyir thos she na /
analyzed: thag ring na 'dug pas ci phyir thos she na /
translated: But if sound is not apprehended at a distance, how is it that one hears it?

original: 'o na de'i tshe gzugs kyang nam mkha'i yon tan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe gzugs kyang nam mkha'i yon tan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, at that time, visible form would also be a quality of space.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha'i de gcig gam du ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha'i de gcig gam du ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, is space one or many?

original: gal te gcig yin na dpag tshad stong phrag tu yang de'i yon tan thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig yin na dpag tshad stong phrag tu yang de'i yon tan thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is one, then sound would be heard even at a distance of a thousand leagues.

original: du ma nyid yin na brjod pa'i yul nyid du thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na brjod pa'i yul nyid du thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is many, then sound would be heard as a variety of sounds.

original: de'i phyir sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin par gang las kyang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin par gang las kyang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, sound is not understood to be a quality of space.

original: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma yin na gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma yin na gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a quality of space, it would not be permanent.

original: don ni gdon mi za bar gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: don ni gdon mi za bar gnas pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But it is not possible that an object is not permanent.

original: de la gzugs dang rig pa dang ro dang dri rnams kyi rten ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi @162b yin no ;
analyzed: de la gzugs dang rig pa dang ro dang dri rnams kyi rten ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi @162b yin no ;
translated: The support of visible form, odor, taste, and tangible objects is the four great elements, earth, etc.

original: / sgra'i ni nam mkha'i yin te rten pa ma yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: / sgra'i ni nam mkha'i yin te rten pa ma yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Sound is not a quality of space, because it is untenable that it is not a support.

original: 'o na ni sa la sogs pa rnams kyang gtan tshigs de nyid kyis nam mkha' la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na ni sa la sogs pa rnams kyang gtan tshigs de nyid kyis nam mkha' la brten pa nyid do //
translated: Well, then, earth and so on are also supported by space, for the same reason.

original: ma yin te yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because they are not qualities.

original: rten pa nyid yin na yon tan ma yin pa de nyid mi 'grub la rten pa ma yin pa nyid na sgra yang yon tan nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rten pa nyid yin na yon tan ma yin pa de nyid mi 'grub la rten pa ma yin pa nyid na sgra yang yon tan nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: If they are supported, it is not established that they are not qualities. If they are not supported, it is not established that sound is a quality.

original: sa la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni yon tan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir yon tan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Earth and so on are not qualities because they are the support of qualities.

original: nam mkha' rten yin na de nyid mi 'grub po //
analyzed: nam mkha' rten yin na de nyid mi 'grub po //
translated: If space is a support, that is not established.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang sa la sogs pa dag ni nam mkha' la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang sa la sogs pa dag ni nam mkha' la brten pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Earth and so on are supported by space.

original: sa la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la 'phrod pa 'du ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Earth and so on are not mixed with space, because they are not combined.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni sa la 'du ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni sa la 'du ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Earth and so on are combined with form and so on.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / dbyer med par 'gyur par gnas pa nyid du zhe na /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / dbyer med par 'gyur par gnas pa nyid du zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the fact of not being separated,

original: 'o na sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na sgra nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin te /
translated: then sound is not a quality of space,

original: de dang lhan cig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu dbyer med par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not perceived as inseparable from space.

original: dri yang sa la de bzhin no //
analyzed: dri yang sa la de bzhin no //
translated: Smell is like this with regard to earth.

original: 'on te nam mkha' la dmigs pa'i phyir sgra ni de la brten ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' la dmigs pa'i phyir sgra ni de la brten ba yin la /
translated: But if you say that sound is based on space because it is perceived in space,

original: de'i gnas kyang de nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnas kyang de nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: and that space is its receptacle,

original: 'o na ni shing bal la sogs pa yang der dmigs pa'i phyir nam mkha' la brten bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni shing bal la sogs pa yang der dmigs pa'i phyir nam mkha' la brten bar 'gyur te /
translated: then cotton wool, etc. would be based on space because they are perceived in space.

original: des 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are held by space.

original: yang ba'i phyir rang nyid gnas pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang ba'i phyir rang nyid gnas pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that they are based on space because they are light,

original: sgra yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas na nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin du 'gyur bas na nam mkha'i yon tan ma yin ba nyid do //
translated: then sound is not a quality of space, because it is light in the same way.

original: 'on te shing bal la sogs pa ni sa la yang gnas so //
analyzed: 'on te shing bal la sogs pa ni sa la yang gnas so //
translated: But cotton wool, etc. are also based on earth.

original: nam mkha' la gnas pa ni nam mkha' byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas pa ni nam mkha' byas pa ma yin te /
translated: But that which is based on space is not based on space, because space is not a basis.

original: rlung gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is carried by the wind.

original: sgra yang de bzhin yin pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin yin pas nam mkha'i yon tan nyid ma yin no //
translated: Sound is also like that. It is not a quality of space.

original: 'di ltar / rlung gis bdas par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rlung gis bdas par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Sound is carried by the wind.

original: sgra ni gzhan du thos pa yin //
analyzed: sgra ni gzhan du thos pa yin //
translated: Sound is heard elsewhere.

original: de yi rten ni rlung nyid do //
analyzed: de yi rten ni rlung nyid do //
translated: The support of sound is the wind.

original: gzhan brtags bas ni ci zhig bya //
analyzed: gzhan brtags bas ni ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of postulating something else?

original: ci ltar rlung gis gzung ba shing bal la sogs pa rlung gi yon tan ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang ngo //
analyzed: ci ltar rlung gis gzung ba shing bal la sogs pa rlung gi yon tan ma yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang ngo //
translated: Just as cotton wool, etc., which are carried by the wind, are not qualities of the wind, so also is sound.

original: ji ltar ras bal nam mkha' la //üîΩrlung gis khyed ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar ras bal nam mkha' la // rlung gis khyed ba de bzhin du //
translated: Just as cotton woolüîΩis carried by the wind in space,

original: sgra yang rlung gis bzlog phyogs ni //
analyzed: sgra yang rlung gis bzlog phyogs ni //
translated: so also is sound

original: gang du'ang sgra ni rig gam ci //
analyzed: gang du'ang sgra ni rig gam ci //
translated: heard in every direction.

original: 'on te yon tan dang ldan pa med ba'i phyir sgra ni rlung gis bda' bar mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te yon tan dang ldan pa med ba'i phyir sgra ni rlung gis bda' bar mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Or, sound cannot be carried by the wind because it does not possess the qualities of being carried.

original: @163a * // shing bal ni 'gal ba med des yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @163a * // shing bal ni 'gal ba med des yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cotton wool is not like that.

original: de lta ma yin na ni nyi ma dang grib ma la sogs pa yang khyer bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni nyi ma dang grib ma la sogs pa yang khyer bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, the sun and shade, etc. would be carried.

original: 'o na ni de ci ste khyer bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni de ci ste khyer bar 'gyur /
translated: But how could that be carried?

original: de'i rten gyi rdzas nyid ded pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rten gyi rdzas nyid ded pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the substance that is its support is carried.

original: gal te 'byor par 'dus ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te 'byor par 'dus ba'i phyir //
translated: If it is carried because of the collection of the elements,

original: rlung gis 'ded par 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: rlung gis 'ded par 'gyur na ni //
translated: then the wind would carry it.

original: rtog 'di'ang sgra la yod min te //
analyzed: rtog 'di'ang sgra la yod min te //
translated: But this idea does not exist in sound.

original: nam mkha' ci ltar khyer bar 'gyur /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' ci ltar khyer bar 'gyur / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: How could space be carried?

original: 'on te nam mkha' khyer na ni //
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' khyer na ni //
translated: But if space is carried,

original: de lta na ni bya med min //üîΩde ni khyab dang khyer ba ni //
analyzed: de lta na ni bya med min // de ni khyab dang khyer ba ni //
translated: then it is not without action.üîΩIt is very difficult to accept

original: srid ces shin tu 'thad par dka' //
analyzed: srid ces shin tu 'thad par dka' //
translated: that it is pervaded and carried.

original: gzhan yang / gal te 'byor pa 'du ba yis ;üîΩ/ khyer ba yin par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te 'byor pa 'du ba yis ; / khyer ba yin par 'dod na ni //
translated: Moreover, if it is carried

original: rlung dang 'byor ba 'du ba yis //
analyzed: rlung dang 'byor ba 'du ba yis //
translated: because of the collection of the elements,

original: 'dus pa yin par cis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin par cis mi 'gyur //
translated: then why is it not the case that the collectionüîΩof the elements is carried by the wind?

original: sgra ni rlung gi yon tan nyid yan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra ni rlung gi yon tan nyid yan par 'gyur te /
translated: Sound is the quality of wind,

original: de'i sgo nas de yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it goes to another place by means of it.

original: rlung gi yon tan ni reg pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi yon tan ni reg pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The quality of wind is touch.

original: rdzas ni yon tan gcig nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rdzas ni yon tan gcig nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because a substance is not ascertained to have only one quality,üîΩbecause the tenets of others are that earth has form, taste, smell, and touch,

original: / sa ni gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sa ni gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi grub mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on.

original: yon tan yin yang dri rlung gis khyer bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: yon tan yin yang dri rlung gis khyer bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Smell is seen to be carried by wind, even though it is a quality.

original: de lta na yang 'byor ba'i sa la 'du ba nyid kyis khyer ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'byor ba'i sa la 'du ba nyid kyis khyer ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though that is so, it is carried by the wind because it is combined with the wind.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de dmigs kyang sa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs kyang sa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it is observed, earth is not observed to be carried by the wind.

original: de las skyes pa 'ba' zhig nyid rlung gis bdas pa yin na ci 'gal /
analyzed: de las skyes pa 'ba' zhig nyid rlung gis bdas pa yin na ci 'gal /
translated: If only that which arises from earth is carried by the wind, what is the contradiction?

original: yon tan ni bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'ba' zhig khyer ba'i phyir ni bya ba med pa de nyid mi 'grub la /
analyzed: yon tan ni bya ba med pa'i phyir ro // 'ba' zhig khyer ba'i phyir ni bya ba med pa de nyid mi 'grub la /
translated: Because a quality is devoid of action.üîΩIf it is carried alone, it is not established to be devoid of action.

original: lhan cig tu khyer na ni bya ba dang bcas par mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: lhan cig tu khyer na ni bya ba dang bcas par mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If it is carried together with earth, it is not established to have action.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause it is not established that it is carried alone.

original: lhan cig pa khyer bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig pa khyer bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that it is carried along with it.

original: yon tan bya ba dang ldan pa ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan bya ba dang ldan pa ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that it possesses qualities and actions?

original: 'di skyon gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skyon gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: This would be another fault.

original: gal te bstan bcos la la yi //
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la la yi //
translated: If in some treatise

original: rigs min yon tan sogs bkag pas //
analyzed: rigs min yon tan sogs bkag pas //
translated: The unreasonableness of qualities and so on is refuted,

original: rigs pa gzhan yang mi 'dod pa //
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan yang mi 'dod pa //
translated: And if another reasoning is not accepted,

original: 'di ni rgyal po'i lugs yin no //üîΩgzhan yang ; rang gi gnas su 'jig pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal po'i lugs yin no // gzhan yang ; rang gi gnas su 'jig pa la //
translated: This is the king‚Äôs law.üîΩMoreover,

original: khyer ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyer ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
translated: The so-called carrying of that which is destroyed in its own place does not exist.

original: bya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bya dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The so-called possession of action

original: 'jig pa'i dngos po la yod min //üîΩde 'dra'i skad cig yul gzhan du //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dngos po la yod min // de 'dra'i skad cig yul gzhan du //
translated: Does not exist in the thing that is destroyed.

original: skye ba yon tan la cis med //
analyzed: skye ba yon tan la cis med //
translated: How could there be no qualities in the arising of such a momentary object in another place?

original: gzhan dag sgra ni chu rlabs dang // 'dra bar 'dod pa min nam ci //üîΩgzhan yang / @163b yon tan las gzhan yon tan can //
analyzed: gzhan dag sgra ni chu rlabs dang // 'dra bar 'dod pa min nam ci // gzhan yang / @163b yon tan las gzhan yon tan can //
translated: Do others not assert that sound is like a water wave?üîΩMoreover,

original: tshad ma yis ni 'thad ma yin //üîΩreg bya la sogs tha dad pa //
analyzed: tshad ma yis ni 'thad ma yin // reg bya la sogs tha dad pa //
translated: The possessor of qualities is not tenable by valid cognition as different from qualities.

original: gzhan pa dmigs su yod dam ci //
analyzed: gzhan pa dmigs su yod dam ci //
translated: Is the difference of tangible objects and so on observed as something else?

original: gal te dri 'byor par 'du bas na /
analyzed: gal te dri 'byor par 'du bas na /
translated: If it is argued that smell is mixed,

original: gang gis sa dang lhan cig 'dod pa yin na sgra yang sa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang lhan cig 'dod pa yin na sgra yang sa la sogs pa'i yon tan nyid do //
translated: If you assert that space is coexistent with earth, then sound is also a quality of earth, etc.

original: des na sa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'dod pa yin pas nam mkha' brtag pas ci bya /
analyzed: des na sa la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'dod pa yin pas nam mkha' brtag pas ci bya /
translated: Therefore, since you assert that space is coexistent with earth, etc., what is the use of postulating space?

original: gzhan yang sa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa las kyis brtag par bya ba yin du chug kyang nam mkha' go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa la sogs pa ni 'dzin pa la sogs pa las kyis brtag par bya ba yin du chug kyang nam mkha' go skabs 'byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Moreover, you may assert that earth, etc., are to be posited by the function of grasping, etc., but space is posited as the provider of opportunity.

original: skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'de ci zhig gnas pa la gnas med pa la //
analyzed: skabs 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'de ci zhig gnas pa la gnas med pa la //
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúprovider of opportunity‚Äù? It is the nonobstruction of the existent.

original: sa la sogs pa ni yul phan tshun gnas pa'i gegs byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni yul phan tshun gnas pa'i gegs byed pa yin te /
translated: Earth, etc., are the obstruction of the mutual existence of objects.

original: de bas na go skabs 'byang bar byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po 'ba' zhig yod dgos la de yang nam mkha' yin no zhe na de yang gyi na ste /
analyzed: de bas na go skabs 'byang bar byed pa'i 'byung ba chen po 'ba' zhig yod dgos la de yang nam mkha' yin no zhe na de yang gyi na ste /
translated: Therefore, the sole great element that is the provider of opportunity must exist, and that is space.üîΩBut that is not so, because:

original: 'di ltar / gal te 'byung ba gzhan gnas nas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te 'byung ba gzhan gnas nas //
translated: If another element exists,

original: gnas pa la ni gags yod min //
analyzed: gnas pa la ni gags yod min //
translated: then there is no obstruction of existence.

original: phan tshun yod pa min na yang //
analyzed: phan tshun yod pa min na yang //
translated: If they do not exist in mutual dependence,üîΩthen they are not elements.

original: gnas pa la ni gags yod min //
analyzed: gnas pa la ni gags yod min //
translated: But there is no obstruction to its endurance.

original: gal te 'byung chen po gzhan //üîΩmed par 'byung chen gzhan gnas na //
analyzed: gal te 'byung chen po gzhan // med par 'byung chen gzhan gnas na //
translated: If another great elementüîΩdoes not exist, on what would the other great elements rest?

original: 'byung ba cha gzhan med pa tsam //
analyzed: 'byung ba cha gzhan med pa tsam //
translated: The mere absence of a portion of the great elements

original: nam mkha' zhes ni bya bar brjod //üîΩgal te nam mkha' med na rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag gang du gnas she na /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes ni bya bar brjod // gal te nam mkha' med na rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po gzhan dag gang du gnas she na /
translated: is called space.üîΩIf space does not exist, on what would the other great elements, such as wind, rest?

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po gzhan med na /üîΩnam mkha' yang gang du gnas zhes thug pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te nam mkha' ni rten med pa'i ngo bo dang / gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ba yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po gzhan med na / nam mkha' yang gang du gnas zhes thug pa med par 'gyur ro // 'on te nam mkha' ni rten med pa'i ngo bo dang / gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ba yang yin no zhe na /
translated: If the other great elements do not exist, on what would space rest?üîΩThus there would be an infinite regress.üîΩBut if space is the support of the other great elements, then it is the support of what has no support.üîΩBut if space is the support of what has no support, then wind is also the support of what has no support, and it is the support of something else.

original: 'o na rlung yang rten med pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ba yang yin pa'i phyir don gzhan yongs su rtogs pa legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na rlung yang rten med pa'i ngo bo dang gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur ba yang yin pa'i phyir don gzhan yongs su rtogs pa legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable to suppose that space is a distinct real entity.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / ci ltar nam mkha' 'ga' zhig tu //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ci ltar nam mkha' 'ga' zhig tu //
translated: How can space be the support of wind,

original: lhung ba'i ngo bo 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: lhung ba'i ngo bo 'dzin ma yin //
translated: since it has no nature of falling?

original: 'gro ba dang ldan rlung gi gzhi //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldan rlung gi gzhi //
translated: The wind is the basis of motion.

original: nam mkha' yin par ci ltar rtogs //
analyzed: nam mkha' yin par ci ltar rtogs //
translated: How can it be known to be space?

original: gal te rlung ni nam mkha' las //
analyzed: gal te rlung ni nam mkha' las //
translated: If you say that wind is space,

original: 'gro la gegs med 'di lan min //
analyzed: 'gro la gegs med 'di lan min //
translated: that is not a response to the question.

original: 'gro ba la ni gegs med pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba la ni gegs med pa //
translated: The absence of obstruction to movement

original: gegs byad pa dang bral bas yin //
analyzed: gegs byad pa dang bral bas yin //
translated: is due to the absence of an obstruction.

original: 'on te khyab dang rtag pa yi //
analyzed: 'on te khyab dang rtag pa yi //
translated: But if space is all-pervading and permanent,

original: nam mkha' gzhan gyis ci ltar 'dzin //
analyzed: nam mkha' gzhan gyis ci ltar 'dzin //
translated: how can it be apprehended as another?

original: des na 'di la rten med cing //
analyzed: des na 'di la rten med cing //
translated: Therefore, it has no basis,

original: gzhan gyi rten du gyur yin na //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rten du gyur yin na //
translated: but it is the basis of others.

original: gzugs med pa dang khyab pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang khyab pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is formless and all-pervading,

original: bdag kyang de yi rang bzhin nyid //üîΩde nyid gzhan @164a * //üîΩgyi rten du ni //
analyzed: bdag kyang de yi rang bzhin nyid // de nyid gzhan @164a * // gyi rten du ni //
translated: the self is also of its very nature.

original: ci yi phyir na rtog ma yin //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na rtog ma yin //
translated: Why is it not imaginedüîΩthat it is the basis of others?

original: gang la de 'dra'i bdag med pa //
analyzed: gang la de 'dra'i bdag med pa //
translated: If it has no self-nature like that,

original: de la nam mkha' ci byar yod //üîΩyul yang khyab phyir nam mkha' yi //
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ci byar yod // yul yang khyab phyir nam mkha' yi //
translated: what is the point of calling it space?üîΩThe activity of space

original: bya ba de las brtag par gyis //
analyzed: bya ba de las brtag par gyis //
translated: should be investigated in terms of its pervasion of objects.

original: phan tshun du ni khyab pas na //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni khyab pas na //
translated: Since they pervade each other,

original: khyab rnams gcig nyid ci ste min //
analyzed: khyab rnams gcig nyid ci ste min //
translated: why are the pervaders not one?

original: gal te nam mkha' la ni snang ba zhes tha snyad bya ba yin gyi bdag la sogs pa las ni ma yin pas de ci ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la ni snang ba zhes tha snyad bya ba yin gyi bdag la sogs pa las ni ma yin pas de ci ltar gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the term ‚Äúspace‚Äù is a designation for the appearance of space, but not for self, etc., how can they be the same?

original: gal te tha snyad kyi rjes su blangs pa de tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pas na de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te tha snyad kyi rjes su blangs pa de tha snyad ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pas na de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: If the meaning of the term is understood in accordance with the term, it is reasonable to accept that the meaning is the same as the term.

original: bu ga nyid nam mkha' yin te pu ga med par byed pa med pa na de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bu ga nyid nam mkha' yin te pu ga med par byed pa med pa na de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that space is a cavity, and the term ‚Äúspace‚Äù is a designation for the absence of a cavity,

original: gang gi tshe bu ga med par byed pa yod pa de'i tshe nam mkha' gar song /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bu ga med par byed pa yod pa de'i tshe nam mkha' gar song /
translated: then when there is no cavity, where does space go?

original: nam mkha' blo nas byung bar ni mi dmigs so //üîΩde med na yang de dang gzhan yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' gar song /
analyzed: nam mkha' blo nas byung bar ni mi dmigs so // de med na yang de dang gzhan yang med pa'i phyir nam mkha' gar song /
translated: Space does not go out of existence, because it is not perceived to go out of existence.

original: zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: zhig go zhe na /
translated: If space does not exist, then since it is neither the same nor different, where does space go?üîΩIf it is argued that space is destroyed,

original: rtag pa ni bzang po de nyid na yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa ni bzang po de nyid na yod do zhe na /
translated: then if it is permanent, it would exist in reality.

original: bu ga yang med la nam mkha' yang yod do zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: bu ga yang med la nam mkha' yang yod do zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that there is no cavity and that space exists.

original: de na yang yod pa nyid de de ltar ma yin na de gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩci ste gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig / ci bzung ba'am /
analyzed: de na yang yod pa nyid de de ltar ma yin na de gnas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na / ci ste gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig / ci bzung ba'am /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be enduring.üîΩBut what is this so-called enduring?

original: 'on te thogs par ma byas pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te thogs par ma byas pa nyid yin /
translated: Is it that which is grasped or that which is not obstructed?

original: gal te gzung ba yin na de ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: gal te gzung ba yin na de ni ma yin te ;
translated: If it is that which is grasped, it is not so.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam mkhas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sas 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam mkhas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sas 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Space does not grasp such things as pots, but rather earth does.

original: 'on te thogs par ma byas pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te thogs par ma byas pa yin na /
translated: But if it is that which is not obstructed,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not tenable either.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / gang las 'di ni thogs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang las 'di ni thogs 'gyur ba //
translated: if it is obstructed by that,

original: de med na de der 'gyur gyi //üîΩnam mkha' la ni thogs med pa //
analyzed: de med na de der 'gyur gyi // nam mkha' la ni thogs med pa //
translated: then it is not space.üîΩSpace is that which is unobstructed.

original: bsal gnas nam mkha' ldang ba yin //
analyzed: bsal gnas nam mkha' ldang ba yin //
translated: It is the mere absence of obstruction.üîΩTherefore,

original: de phyir 'byung ba chen bo bzhi //
analyzed: de phyir 'byung ba chen bo bzhi //
translated: if the four great elements do not exist,

original: med na nam mkha' zhes brjod de //üîΩ'byung chen de las gzhan dag tu //
analyzed: med na nam mkha' zhes brjod de // 'byung chen de las gzhan dag tu //
translated: space is said to exist.üîΩBut it is not tenable to designate

original: bsnyad pa tshad ma dang ldan min //
analyzed: bsnyad pa tshad ma dang ldan min //
translated: anything else as a great element.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyang brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyang brjod pa yin te /
translated: This also expresses our position.

original: de yang khyab pa nyid kyis skabs 'byed pa la sogs pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / khyab la nub phyogs la sogs par //
analyzed: de yang khyab pa nyid kyis skabs 'byed pa la sogs pa nyid ma yin no // 'di ltar / khyab la nub phyogs la sogs par //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the direction is distinguished by pervasion.üîΩThus:üîΩThe direction pervaded is not

original: rtogs min gzhan pa las ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs min gzhan pa las ma yin //
translated: understood as other than the east, etc.

original: de la gzhan 'go yod min te //
analyzed: de la gzhan 'go yod min te //
translated: There is no other direction,

original: de ni med par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med par thal phyir ro //
translated: because that would entail the error of nonexistence.

original: gal te khyab pa'i yul de nyid shar yin na de las gzhan du gnas pa'i nub tu ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te khyab pa'i yul de nyid shar yin na de las gzhan du gnas pa'i nub tu ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the very place that is pervaded is the east, how could it be the west, which is located in another place than that?

original: 'on te de las rang bzhin gnyi ga yin na /
analyzed: 'on te de las rang bzhin gnyi ga yin na /
translated: Or, if it is the nature of both,

original: de lta yin na gnyi gar @164b rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gnyi gar @164b rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that both would be understood.

original: 'on te so sor nges pa'i gsal byed yod pa las yul gyi rang bzhin du ma las rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te so sor nges pa'i gsal byed yod pa las yul gyi rang bzhin du ma las rang bzhin 'ga' zhig gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if it is the case that from the existence of a distinct manifestor, some nature of the place is manifested from among many natures,

original: dper na pha dang bul sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag / bu la sogs pa la ltos nas pha la sogs pa mngon par gsal pa bzhin no zhe na ;
analyzed: dper na pha dang bul sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag / bu la sogs pa la ltos nas pha la sogs pa mngon par gsal pa bzhin no zhe na ;
translated: just as the nature of father, son, etc., is manifested as father, son, etc., in dependence on each other.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not the case.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / yul gyi rang bzhin nges pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yul gyi rang bzhin nges pa ni //
translated: The nature of the place is ascertained

original: gzhan gang las ni gsal 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gzhan gang las ni gsal 'gyur ba //
translated: And from what other thing is it manifest?

original: de nyid las ni shar phyogs su //
analyzed: de nyid las ni shar phyogs su //
translated: From that very thing, in the east,

original: dngos rnams rang bzhin rigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos rnams rang bzhin rigs par 'gyur //
translated: The nature of things would be logical.

original: gang las phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba de shar dang nub la sogs pa gnas pa'i skyes bu la ltos nas nub la sogs par 'gyur ba de nyid las dngos po nyid de ltar 'gyur bar ci ste khas mi len /
analyzed: gang las phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba de shar dang nub la sogs pa gnas pa'i skyes bu la ltos nas nub la sogs par 'gyur ba de nyid las dngos po nyid de ltar 'gyur bar ci ste khas mi len /
translated: Since the division of directions is dependent on the person who is situated in the east or the west, why not accept that the nature of things is just that?

original: skyes bu la sogs pa yul gzhan la ltos nas shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i phyir shar phyogs nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa yul gzhan la ltos nas shar gyi yul na gnas pa'i phyir shar phyogs nyid yin no //
translated: Since the person and so on are situated in the eastern region in dependence on other regions, the east is just that.

original: de yang nyi ma la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: de yang nyi ma la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs brtags pas ci bya /
translated: Since that is also dependent on the sun, what is the point of designating directions?

original: gal te nyi ma la sogs pa dag las phyogs mngon par gsal bar yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyi ma la sogs pa dag las phyogs mngon par gsal bar yin na /
translated: If the directions are manifest from the sun and so on,

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i shar phyogs kyi nyi ma la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i shar phyogs kyi nyi ma la sogs pa yang /
translated: then the sun and so on in the east would be the east.

original: des yin pa'i phyir 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i phyir skyon de yin no //
analyzed: des yin pa'i phyir 'di ni phan tshun rten pa'i phyir skyon de yin no //
translated: Since that is also dependent on the sun, this is the error of mutual dependence.

original: de tsam gyis tha snyad rab tu 'grub ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
analyzed: de tsam gyis tha snyad rab tu 'grub ba'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa'i 'bad pas ci bya /
translated: Since the conventional is established merely by that, what is the use of the effort of relying on another?

original: gal te ltos pa med par yang 'di ni drang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir yul don gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltos pa med par yang 'di ni drang po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir yul don gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is a different thing because the convention ‚ÄúThis is straight‚Äù would occur even without relying on another,üîΩthat is not so.

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / der yang drang zhes ltos bya ba'i //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / 'di ltar / der yang drang zhes ltos bya ba'i //
translated: Thus,üîΩThe perception of the difference

original: khyad par mthong ba yod pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba yod pa yin //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is straight in relation to that‚Äù exists.

original: phyi nas shin tu goms pas na //
analyzed: phyi nas shin tu goms pas na //
translated: Later, through great familiarity,

original: gzhan med par ni de ltar rtogs //
analyzed: gzhan med par ni de ltar rtogs //
translated: one understands it to be so without another.

original: 'di la khyod la drang po yin no zhes 'jig rten na tha snyad dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la khyod la drang po yin no zhes 'jig rten na tha snyad dmigs pa yin no //
translated: In the world, the perception of the convention ‚ÄúThis is straight for you‚Äù exists.

original: de las kyang shin tu goms pa las phyis de'i rjes su 'brangs te ltos par bya ba med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang shin tu goms pa las phyis de'i rjes su 'brangs te ltos par bya ba med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, through great familiarity with that, one follows it and the object of reliance does not exist.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba las rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du yang de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed ba las rgyu dang rgyu can gyi dngos po yin no //
translated: Because the relation of cause and effect exists from the activity of following and reversing that even in relation to another.

original: 'di ltar / rgya mtsho'i dkyil na gnas pa'i mi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgya mtsho'i dkyil na gnas pa'i mi //
translated: a man who is born in the middle of the oceanüîΩwould not know the directionsüîΩbecause he has never seen the stars and planets.

original: 'khrul pa skyes par gyur pa dag / gza' dang skar ma mthong ba yis //
analyzed: 'khrul pa skyes par gyur pa dag / gza' dang skar ma mthong ba yis //
translated: But when he sees the stars and planets,

original: phyogs kyi rnam dbye nges par 'gyur //üîΩskar ma la sogs dang 'brel las //
analyzed: phyogs kyi rnam dbye nges par 'gyur // skar ma la sogs dang 'brel las //
translated: he will know the directions.

original: phyogs gzhan pa ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan pa ni mthong ba med //
translated: In the same way, the directions are not known

original: rang gi @165a * //
analyzed: rang gi @165a * //
translated: because of the sun,

original: ngo bor snang ba ni //üîΩde rtogs par ni ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: ngo bor snang ba ni // de rtogs par ni ji ltar brjod //
translated: but the sun is known because of the directions.üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions,üîΩthen what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?

original: 'di ltar shar phyogs zhes bya bas ni nyi ma 'char ba dang 'brel pa nyid la nges par gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩde ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shar phyogs zhes bya bas ni nyi ma 'char ba dang 'brel pa nyid la nges par gnas par 'gyur ba yin no // de ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?

original: nyi ma bzhin du mthong yang phyogs la rmongs pa skyes pa'i yid can rnams sngar rtogs pa'i phyogs de nyid shes par 'gyur gyi /üîΩnyi ma 'char pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin du mthong yang phyogs la rmongs pa skyes pa'i yid can rnams sngar rtogs pa'i phyogs de nyid shes par 'gyur gyi / nyi ma 'char pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?

original: 'di ltar nyi ma 'char ba yang nub phyogs la brten par rtogs pa yin no //üîΩzhe na de la yang brjod pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyi ma 'char ba yang nub phyogs la brten par rtogs pa yin no //üîΩzhe na de la yang brjod pa //
translated: If you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?üîΩIf you say that the sun is known because of the directions, then what is the sun?

original: gang la ma 'khrul yid kyis ni //
analyzed: gang la ma 'khrul yid kyis ni //
translated: But the mind that is not confused

original: nub dang 'brel 'dod gyur pa la //
analyzed: nub dang 'brel 'dod gyur pa la //
translated: In regard to the direction in which the sun is setting,

original: kun dga' grong sogs kyis mtshan pa'i //
analyzed: kun dga' grong sogs kyis mtshan pa'i //
translated: In a place that is characterized by a town, a grove, and so on,

original: yul der de nyid yin par goms //
analyzed: yul der de nyid yin par goms //
translated: It is familiar with that very direction.

original: grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa gang dag sngon gyi gnas skabs su nyi ma 'char ba la ltos te nub phyogs la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon brtag par rgyun du dmigs pa de la goms pas nyams ba'i phyir nyi ma 'char ba'i rjes su mi 'brang
analyzed: grong dang kun dga' rab la sogs pa gang dag sngon gyi gnas skabs su nyi ma 'char ba la ltos te nub phyogs la sogs pa'i nye bar mtshon brtag par rgyun du dmigs pa de la goms pas nyams ba'i phyir nyi ma 'char ba'i rjes su mi 'brang
translated: In a place that is characterized by a town, a grove, and so on, in a previous state, when the sun is rising, the direction of the setting sun is observed. Because of the familiarity with that, the mind does not follow the rising sun.

original: gi /'on kyang des nye bar mtshon pa de nyid phyogs yin no zhes bag chags brten pa dang 'brel pa las tha snyad du byed do //üîΩde'i phyir / thog med bag chags dang 'brel pa //
analyzed: gi /'on kyang des nye bar mtshon pa de nyid phyogs yin no zhes bag chags brten pa dang 'brel pa las tha snyad du byed do // de'i phyir / thog med bag chags dang 'brel pa //
translated: But it is conventionally said that the direction that is indicated by that is the direction, because of the connection with the latent ten dency.üîΩTherefore,

original: mngon du phyogs pa'i sems rnams kyi //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa'i sems rnams kyi //
translated: The mind that is connected with beginningless latent tendenciesüîΩIn regard to the direction in which the sun is setting,

original: de ni don dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni don dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of an object,

original: rtogs pa 'ba' zhig nyid yin no//
analyzed: rtogs pa 'ba' zhig nyid yin no//
translated: It is only a conception.

original: shin tu sems gtad pa la phyogs pa g-ying ba thag gcad pa'i yid dang ldan pa yang phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni med de /
analyzed: shin tu sems gtad pa la phyogs pa g-ying ba thag gcad pa'i yid dang ldan pa yang phyogs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni med de /
translated: The mind that is very focused on a direction, and that is decisive about the direction, does not ascertain the nature of the direction.

original: 'on kyang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: However, because it is free from analysis,

original: 'jig rten de'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten de'i rang bzhin nges pa med pa /
translated: the nature of the world is not ascertained.

original: song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis yid nyams pa nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir 'dir ci byar yod /
analyzed: song ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis yid nyams pa nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir 'dir ci byar yod /
translated: Since it is a mental state that follows the traces of the past, what can be done about it?

original: gal te thog med phyir bden na //
analyzed: gal te thog med phyir bden na //
translated: If it is true because it is beginningless,

original: med pa pa yang bden par 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa pa yang bden par 'gyur //
translated: then nihilism would also be true.

original: dbang phyug la sogs rtogs pa yang //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs rtogs pa yang //
translated: If the conception of ƒ™≈õvara and so on

original: thog ma med phyir cis mi bden //üîΩdes na phyogs sogs gnas pa yi //
analyzed: thog ma med phyir cis mi bden // des na phyogs sogs gnas pa yi //
translated: is not true because it is beginningless,üîΩthen this system of the permanence of directions and so on

original: lugs 'di legs pa nyid ma yin //üîΩ'di ni bstan bcos ngan goms las//
analyzed: lugs 'di legs pa nyid ma yin // 'di ni bstan bcos ngan goms las//
translated: is not good.üîΩThis is just a mere convention

original: nyer 'ongs tha snyad tsam du zad //üîΩthog ma med phyir bstan bcos rnams //
analyzed: nyer 'ongs tha snyad tsam du zad // thog ma med phyir bstan bcos rnams //
translated: that has come about from being accustomed to bad treatises.üîΩBecause it is beginningless,

original: thams cad bden par 'gyur min te //
analyzed: thams cad bden par 'gyur min te //
translated: all treatises are not true.

original: phan tshun 'gal bas gnod bya dang // gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas gnod bya dang // gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: because they are mutually contradictory, they are the nature of that which is to be refuted and that which refutes.

original: de'i phyir don rnams nyid phan tshun ltos nas shar ro nub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming du tha snyad kyi @165b don du rgan po dag gis bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don rnams nyid phan tshun ltos nas shar ro nub po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming du tha snyad kyi @165b don du rgan po dag gis bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the elders have established the terms ‚Äúeast‚Äù and ‚Äúwest‚Äù as the referents of conventions, in dependence on the very objects themselves.

original: 'du byed ba yang thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir tha snyad nyid sad par 'gyur bas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed ba yang thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir tha snyad nyid sad par 'gyur bas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: Since the compounded also has no beginning, the convention itself is awakened. Thus, the convention is made.

original: tha dad par nye bar bstan pa'i ngo bo de nyid dus la sogs par brjod pa la ston pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par nye bar bstan pa'i ngo bo de nyid dus la sogs par brjod pa la ston pa yin te /
translated: The very nature that is taught as distinct is taught as time, etc.üîΩIt is said:

original: 'di ltar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt arises.‚Äù

original: da ltar yod do //
analyzed: da ltar yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúIt exists now.‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa las lhas byin la sogs pa'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i 'us gsum par 'jog dus byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa las kyang dus gzhan gnas par thal ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs pa las lhas byin la sogs pa'i 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i 'us gsum par 'jog dus byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa las kyang dus gzhan gnas par thal ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and ‚Äúwill arise‚Äù is understood, then Devadatta‚Äôs past and future, etc., would be the present. And if ‚Äúarises‚Äù and so on were the present, it would follow that the other times would endure.

original: 'on te dus ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis snga ma yin gyi dus gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dus ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis snga ma yin gyi dus gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if time is prior by its intrinsic reality and does not depend on another time,

original: phyogs kyang de bzhin te rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bye brag gis tha snyad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs kyang de bzhin te rang gi ngo bor 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bye brag gis tha snyad byed pa yin te /
translated: then direction would be the same, since it is designated by the particularity of a phenomenon that is prior by its intrinsic reality.

original: shar ni dbang po'i phyogs so zhes so zhe na /
analyzed: shar ni dbang po'i phyogs so zhes so zhe na /
translated: The east is the direction of Indra.

original: de lta na shing la sogs pa'i don rnams kyang rang nyid snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa yin gyi snga ma nyid la sogs pas dus gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na shing la sogs pa'i don rnams kyang rang nyid snga ma dang phyi ma la sogs pa yin gyi snga ma nyid la sogs pas dus gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then objects such as trees would be prior and posterior by themselves, and not by prior and posterior times.

original: 'on te ngo ba la sogs pa'i snga ma nyid la sogs pa ni rang las ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ngo ba la sogs pa'i snga ma nyid la sogs pa ni rang las ma yin te /
translated: But the prior state of the thing itself does not exist.

original: 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa'i don la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang 'brel pa'i don la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the meaning of ‚Äúprior‚Äù depends on a related object.üîΩIn this way,

original: 'di ltar / rgyal po gang dag sngar 'das pa //üîΩde dang 'brel pa la ltos na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rgyal po gang dag sngar 'das pa // de dang 'brel pa la ltos na //
translated: the king who passed away in the past

original: de la dus 'das yun ring zhes //
analyzed: de la dus 'das yun ring zhes //
translated: is posited as ‚Äúlong ago‚ÄùüîΩin dependence on a related object.

original: bya ba nyid du rnam par 'jog /'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: bya ba nyid du rnam par 'jog /'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: gal te dus kyis 'das pa sogs //
analyzed: gal te dus kyis 'das pa sogs //
translated: If the past and so on

original: dngos dang 'brel pa las yin na //
analyzed: dngos dang 'brel pa las yin na //
translated: of a thing exist in dependence on a related object,

original: dngos po yi ni 'das nyid de //
analyzed: dngos po yi ni 'das nyid de //
translated: then the past of the thing

original: dus la ltos par 'gyur bas na //
